Job Summary:
OANDA is a world leader in online foreign exchange ("forex") trading. Forex is one of the largest markets in the world, with trillions of dollars in trading volume each year. OANDA has been providing online currency information and trading for over 20 years. In that time we have earned a reputation for excellence and integrity in our industry.

As a React Native Software Developer, you will be joining a small and dynamic agile team. You will be building OANDA's next generation web-based trading platforms using state of the art web and native technologies. You will wrangle asynchronous streams of data, and craft responsive user interfaces.

We ship code often, so you will quickly see your work running in production. You will be paired up with a senior developer, working collaboratively with other developers and designers, with plenty of opportunities to learn from the team. Our team values continuous improvement, and we welcome new ideas. You'll even have the opportunity to improve our development processes.

You'll be joining:
- A small team of highly-motivated and talented developers.
- A friendly and collaborative company with people who have embraced working remotely.
- An agile development shop in a growing, profitable company.
- A culture with mentors who want to see you succeed.
Job Responsibilities:
- Work on an award-winning platform that processes billions of dollars every day
- Be on a team that's responsible for company-wide top priority projects
- Deliver reliable software on an agile team using continuous integration, automated testing, and code reviews
- Have real customer facing impact by enhancing the daily trading experience of thousands of customers
- Contribute innovative ideas to improve our customer experience and our software systems
- Respond to customer feedback and support issues
Required Skills:
- A keen interest in web and application development
- Strong front-end web development skills: HTML5, CSS, Modern Javascript (ES6, Promises)
- Experience with a front-end Javascript framework (e.g. React, Angular, Polymer, Redux)
- A solid foundation in Computer Science
- Understanding of automated testing methodologies
- Experience with Git or other version control systems
- Experience working with REST API's

Bonus points if you have:
- Experience with TypeScript
- Familiarity with functional programming principles
- Experience working in an Agile environment
- Contributions to an open-source project (of any kind)
- An account on Github.com with samples of your code
Targeted Degrees and Disciplines:
Targeted Clusters
			

		
		
			
				- Theme - Computing: Software
				
			
				ENG - Electrical and Computer Engineering
				
			
				ENG - Software Engineering
				
			
				ENG - Systems Design and Biomedical Engineering
				
			
				MATH - Computer Science
Application Documents Required: University of Waterloo Co-op Work History,Résumé,Grade Report

Job Summary:
Talented Software Engineers are critical to OANDA's business success: as a software company - our products are only as good as the people who create them. With that in mind, OANDA looks for highly intelligent, innovative, and dedicated people.

Our team:
- Is responsible for most of the backend systems that enable our customers to trade
- Isn't afraid to take on any important work that needs to be done
- Works primarily in C++ with some Python as well
- Also uses Linux, SQL/DB2, REST, protobuf, and more

We value our people:
- Monday breakfast, Tuesday pizza dinner, and Wednesday lunch
- Free coffee, cold drinks, and snacks
- Advance your career through company-sponsored education and training
- Attend company hosted events with speakers in our industry
- Participate in quarterly hack-a-thons where you're given two weekdays to hack
Job Responsibilities:
- Working within a Linux environment, you will research, design, test, implement, and maintain online and backend trading and data services infrastructure applications.
- Work closely with OANDA's business and technical leadership to understand business requirements, and will collaborate with development team members to design and write applications systems and programs.
- Finally, you will test and debug applications to ensure proper performance, and will be responsible for developing/modifying program documentation.
Required Skills:
- Working towards a University degree in computer science, computer engineering, or a related field
- Application development experience using C++ is an asset
- Relevant experience in the development of Internet-ready applications programs using Internet communications protocols (TCP/IP) is an asset
- Experience with UNIX / Linux / Solaris operating systems is an asset
- A strong team orientation combined with the drive and ability to contribute at the individual level
- Exceptional communications skills ? both oral and written
- Any experience with scripting languages such as Python would be an asset

Job Summary:
We have come a long way since our first currency feed 23 years ago, we are an award-winning global company offering leading currency solutions for both retail and corporate clients, from a tech start-up to a global corporation. Founded in 1996, we became the first company to share exchange rate information on the internet free of charge and in 2001, we launched a trading platform that helped pioneer the development of online-based trading around the world, enabling forex and CFD investors the ability to trade the financial markets.  Our vision is to transform how our clients can meet all of their currency needs with innovative and award-winning solutions. Under new ownership with significant ambitions to grow the business on the global stage, we are looking for highly motivated, passionate individuals who want to make a mark in a dynamic environment. 

We are looking for engineers who are passionate about what they do and are eager to both learn and inspire others.

We are:
- A small team of highly-motivated and talented engineers.
- A friendly and collaborative company with an open office environment.
- An agile development shop in a growing, profitable company
Job Responsibilities:
As a Back-End Developer, you will:
- Write reusable, testable, and efficient code
- Design and implement low-latency, high-availability, and performant APIs
- Partner with front-end engineers to define API interfaces
- Help us deprecate our legacy systems and champion microservices architecture
- Help us move our back-end systems to the cloud
- Integrate with data storage solutions such as DB2, Redis etc.
- Integrate with third party identity verification (EID) APIs
- Review others' code to ensure all the best standards are met
- Independently analyze problems and develop creative solutions Create and maintain documentation
Required Skills:
Qualifications:
- Software development experience in Python
- Knowledge of at least one Python web framework (such as Pyramid, Django, Flask, etc.
- Strong Back-End/API development skills
- Basic understanding of front-end technologies, such as JavaScript and HTML
- A solid foundation in Computer Science
- An understanding of fault-tolerant, resilient and highly-available applications
- Knowledge of user authentication and authorization between multiple systems, servers, and environments
- Able to create database schemas that represent and support business processes
- Knowledge of SQL, data normalization, indices, and comfortable with complex joins
- Strong unit test and debugging skills
- Experience with Git or other version control systems

Bonus points if you have:
- Familiarity with NGINX routing, Docker and Kubernetes
- Experience with cloud preferably GCP
- Experience bringing legacy software up to date
- Contributions to an open-source project (of any kind)
- An account on GitHub.com with samples of your code
Targeted Degrees and Disciplines:
Targeted Clusters
			

		
		
			
				- Theme - Computing: Information Systems 
				
			
				- Theme - Computing: Software
				
			
				ENG - Electrical and Computer Engineering
				
			
				ENG - Mechanical and Mechatronics Engineering
				
			
				ENG - Software Engineering
				
			
				MATH - Computer Science

Job Summary:
We have come a long way since our first currency feed 23 years ago, we are an award-winning global company offering leading currency solutions for both retail and corporate clients, from a tech start-up to a global corporation. Founded in 1996, we became the first company to share exchange rate information on the internet free of charge and in 2001, we launched a trading platform that helped pioneer the development of online-based trading around the world, enabling forex and CFD investors the ability to trade the financial markets.  Our vision is to transform how our clients can meet all of their currency needs with innovative and award-winning solutions. Under new ownership with significant ambitions to grow the business on the global stage, we are looking for highly motivated, passionate individuals who want to make a mark in a dynamic environment.

OANDA Canada's head office is located in the heart of the entertainment district with convenient access to public transit and other downtown Toronto amenities. OANDA continues to expand its global presence with offices in the US, Canada, UK, Poland, Malta, Japan,Singapore and Australia. 

Who You Are: 

You are an aspiring user experience and user interface designer who is passionate about creating the best experience for users in the digital space. With a broad range of platforms and unique usability patterns, the successful candidate enjoys the challenge of solving user experience issues inherent to the mobile, tablet, and desktop space. The candidate will be required to design and create a consistent and friendly user experience across all platforms. You will work on all aspects of OANDA's flagship fxTrade app, influencing both the user experience and interface. You are also a strong team player who collaborates well with other groups and is also a self-starter who enjoys learning with the team.

As the user experience and interface designer, you will also have a passion for understanding users and how they interact with digital products. You will be expected to conduct usability research by building usability tests, conducting the usability sessions, and gathering results for further analyzes. You will be involved in the definition, design and development of new features where performance and user experience must be world class. You must also be update to date and familiar with UX patterns and trends. You will be involved in all aspects of the user experience process and be a champion for the user through understanding and delivery.
Job Responsibilities:
* Work on applications that are used thousands of times per day 
* Enhance the daily trading user experience of thousands of customers 
* Contribute innovative ideas which will build upon OANDA's award-winning trading platform 
* Create wireframes and sketches showing the user experience flow
* Use Adobe Creative Suite to build visual design comps
* Collaborate with other designers and programmers to prototype user experiences
* Building and conducting usability testing sessions
* Gather feedback through usability testing to ensure the proposed user experience meets user expectations and presents findings and recommendations to drive future design
* Create documentation for user experience and design guidelines 
* Have a strong interest in understanding the broad range of skills encompassing user experience design, such as visual design, information architecture, interaction design, usability, user research and content strategy
Required Skills:
* Specializing in mobile, web or interaction design, user research and/or HCI
* Strong working knowledge of the Adobe Creative Suite, especially Photoshop and Illustrator
* Strong conceptualization ability and visual communication ability
* Experience and understanding of user interface and visual design patterns
* Ability to create wireframes using wireframing programs
* Strong written and verbal skills
* Exceptional design and production skills with strong attention to detail
* A high personal standard when it comes to user experience and interface design and usability 
* A passion for all technologies especially in the mobile and desktop space

BONUS SKILLS
* Creating working prototypes
* Experience in data visualization
* Iconography skills
* Responsive design skills
Targeted Degrees and Disciplines:
Targeted Clusters
			

		
		
			
				- Theme - Digital and Graphic Media; Web Site Design and Development 
				
			
				ARTS - Business
				
			
				ARTS - Fine and Performing Arts
Application Documents Required: University of Waterloo Co-op Work History,Résumé,Grade Report

Job Summary:
We have come a long way since our first currency feed 23 years ago, we are an award-winning global company offering leading currency solutions for both retail and corporate clients, from a tech start-up to a global corporation. Founded in 1996, we became the first company to share exchange rate information on the internet free of charge and in 2001, we launched a trading platform that helped pioneer the development of online-based trading around the world, enabling forex and CFD investors the ability to trade the financial markets.  Our vision is to transform how our clients can meet all of their currency needs with innovative and award-winning solutions. Under new ownership with significant ambitions to grow the business on the global stage, we are looking for highly motivated, passionate individuals who want to make a mark in a dynamic environment. 

We are looking for a co-op data engineer to help us build our next generation data platform on Google Cloud. This is an exciting role where you will be working alongside experienced data engineers and data scientists on the next generation platform for business intelligence and analytics.
Job Responsibilities:
During a typical week you will ... 
- Have the chance to develop various ETL tools, for both batch and real time processing.  
- Discuss and design the complete life cycle of the flow of information from the data source to end business user.
- Utilize state of the art cloud based tools such as Google Cloud Storage, BigQuery, Apache Beam, PubSub, BigTable and Airflow.
- Pilot and assess the latest data platform technologies and make recommendations to management on which would best fit into our company-wide data architecture
- Work with internal tools for enabling the networks and the right connections.   
- Pull data from third party APIs such as Salesforce and Marketo and help prepare the information for reporting purposes.
- Investigate the cause of a failed and missing customer record.
- Be exposed to the strict importance of monitoring, verifying and securing the flow of financial information.
Required Skills:
We are looking for ...
- Experience with OOP, specifically in languages such as Python, Java or Scala.
- Quick learner and eager to be the first on the team to try out new tools.
- Exposure or an interest in working with any one of the Big Data technologies such as BigQuery, Kafka, Airflow, Apache Nifi, or Spark.
- An excellent team player with the desire to communicate (both verbal and written).
- Enthusiastic about collaborative problem solving.
- Motivated by challenges and open ended problems.

Bonus points if you have..
Experience with SQL and using tools for visualizing or monitoring data.

Job Summary:
Please note that ODAIA is commited to provide a safe working arrangement to our students given the ongoing COVID-19 situation. We offer remote working arrangements for the 2020 Fall Term depending on the pandemic situation and public health recommendations at that time. 
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Software Engineer

ODAIA is a data analytics, process mining and machine learning platform for enterprise sales optimization, churn analysis and prediction. We help companies DISCOVER, UNDERSTAND, and PREDICT the journeys of their customers and things that move through their organization.

OUR MISSION
To help companies create efficiencies and grow revenues by transforming their businesses around the customer while driving engagement and commercial growth.

OUR VISION
To be the catalyst that allows companies to unlock value from their data

What's on Offer
- Remote working capabilities and hardware delivery
- Flexible hours. We believe in work-life balance.
- Working to productize state of the art Process Mining and ML algorithms
- Family oriented startup culture with online social gatherings
- Tremendous growth, high impact role, and opportunities to learn and be challenged

Your day to day...
- You will be part of a small team, with a large amount of ownership and autonomy for managing things directly.
- You will own a large part of the process from problem understanding, R&D, to shipping the solution. 
- You will ship high quality, scalable and robust solutions with a sense of urgency.
Job Responsibilities:
You may be responsible for some of these tasks:
- Develop and productize new or existing ML algorithms under the supervision of our in-house data science experts
- Back-end develop and deployment of new algorithms in popular cloud platforms such as AWS
- Microservice design and containerization of ML algorithms
- Parallelization of algorithms using various approaches: multi-thread, multi-process, and GPU parallelization 
- Validation and testing of algorithms
- Front end development powered by React
Required Skills:
- Understanding of data structures, algorithms and design principles and patterns. Let's make use of those courses!
- Knowledge of one or more common technology stacks: Python, Node.js, React, Java, .NET Core, etc... 
- Experience in full-stack development with microservices architecture expertise is highly valued 
- Familiarity with data manipulation, analysis and ML libraries

Job Summary:
Odyssey Group
Odyssey Group Holdings, Inc. and its subsidiaries, collectively referred to as the Odyssey Group, is one of the world's leading providers of reinsurance and specialty insurance with headquarters in Stamford, Connecticut. Odyssey Group is a wholly-owned subsidiary of Fairfax Financial Holdings Limited. 

Fairfax Financial Holdings Limited is a financial services holding company which, through its subsidiaries, is engaged in property and casualty insurance and reinsurance and investment management. Fairfax's corporate objective is to achieve a high rate of return on invested capital and build long-term shareholder value.  For more information please visit fairfax.ca.
  
Actuarial Intern
OdysseyRe Canadian Branch is a major player in the Canadian reinsurance market. OdysseyRe is committed to deliver high-quality solution to our clients. We are seeking new and innovative solution to every changing challenges faced by our clients.

We are looking for a highly motivated and accomplished individual with a proven academic track record and strong analytical skills. An Actuarial role will provide you with the opportunity to work with multiple stakeholders and to develop your skills on challenging assignments while making a meaningful contribution to OdysseyRe.

Fairfax Co-op Program
Odyssey Group is a partner in the Fairfax Co-op Program.The Fairfax Co-op Program is looking for innovative, talented and self-motivated University of Waterloo students who are interested in domestic and international work experience throughout the Fairfax group of companies.   

For more information on the Fairfax Co-op Program please visit co-op.fairfax.ca.

Organization: Office of the Superintendent of Financial Institutions
Job Summary:
JOB DESCRIPTION

The Actuarial Division at the Office of the Superintendent of Financial Institutions is seeking a motivated, energetic student to work in our Toronto office. This is a great opportunity that will provide actuarial experience in both property & casualty insurance and in life insurance with a focus on property & casualty insurance.

The student will gain experience to reserving and capital management and will be exposed to leading edge insurance issues and may support broader benchmarking projects from an actuarial perspective. The work will expose the student to actuarial practices for many Canadian insurance companies which will provide valuable knowledge of the Canadian insurance market and insurance products being sold that can rarely be gained by working at any one insurer. The student may have an opportunity to participate in on-sites and attend external meetings. The student will gain insights into the workings of a financial regulator and how the insurance industry is regulated to ensure financial solvency.
Job Responsibilities:
DUTIES

- Conduct preliminary reviews and analysis of property & casualty and life insurance actuarial reports. 
- Provide support to assist in divisional projects and initiatives.
Required Skills:
ADDITIONAL SKILLS

- The ability to work on Excel spreadsheets.
- Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal.
- Excellent organizational skills.
- Basic knowledge of insurance industry.
- Basic understanding of financial analysis and financial systems.
- Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
- Ability to take initiative and find ways to conduct a task more efficiently.
Targeted Degrees and Disciplines:

The Office of the Superintendent of Financial Institutions (OSFI) supervises and regulates federally regulated banks and insurers, trust and loan companies as well as private pension plans subject to federal oversight.
 
The Insurance Supervision Sector is seeking four students to work remotely or in our busy Toronto office. This is a great learning experience for any business, finance, accounting or economic students looking at building knowledge of the regulatory environment as a lead into a career in the financial industry.

More information about OSFI can be obtained by looking at the website www.osfi-bsif.gc.ca. To show that you have reviewed the job description in detail, please include the name of OSFI's current Superintendent in your cover letter.
 
Preference will be given to Canadian citizens. You must indicate on your application whether you are a Canadian citizen, a permanent resident, or are entitled to work in Canada by means of a work permit.

Organization: Office of the Superintendent of Financial Institutions
Job Summary:
JOB DESCRIPTION
The Office of the Superintendent of Financial Institutions ("OSFI") supervises and regulates federally regulated banks and insurers, trust and loan companies as well as private pension plans subject to federal oversight. 
 
OSFI's Model Risk Division (MRD) is seeking 1 student with an interest in banking to work remotely or in our busy Toronto office. This position will provide the opportunity to gain risk measurement, risk analytics and/or broader analytical experience, as well as provide insight into the workings of a financial regulator. You will be working with a team responsible for assessing the methodology, governance and oversight of models used by Federally Regulated Financial Institutions ("FRFI"). These include regulatory capital models and those used for other enterprise functions or activities. This is a great learning experience for any business, finance or economic students looking at building knowledge of the regulatory environment as a lead into a career in the financial industry.
 
More information about OSFI can be obtained by looking at the website www.osfi-bsif.gc.ca.
Job Responsibilities:
DUTIES:

Financial analysis and/ or risk reporting on assigned industries and markets.
Surveillance/Research of significant risk issues that have an impact on financial institutions.
Special projects relating to the collection and organization of financial data.
Risk management through data mining/extraction of financial institution submissions and industry information.
Providing support with divisional projects and initiatives.
Providing support to the supervisory team which will include monitoring, analysis and reporting.
Conducting the deposit-taking institution (DTI) capital model approval and monitoring the model performance through significant activity reviews.
Risk management through monitoring and on-site reviews of financial institutions.
Researching significant news items/press releases that have an impact on financial institutions.
Special projects relating to the collection and organization of financial data.
Other duties as required.
Required Skills:
EXPERIENCE/ SKILLS:

Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal.
Excellent organizational skills.
Sound understanding of financial analysis and financial systems.
Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
Ability to take initiative and find improved ways to conduct a task more efficiently.
Experience with big data analytics, data visualization, and/or unstructured data would be beneficial.
Knowledge of script languages (e.g. Python) and statistical packages (e.g. Matlab, R, SAS) would be an asset.
Strong analytical skills with the ability to work with Access/SQL Server, Excel and other analytical software would be an asset.

Job Summary:
Why Join Us? 
Come aboard if you are excited by challenges and at ease working across cultures. You'll find interesting people who speak their minds and measure success not by how many hours are worked but by what gets accomplished.
 
Immediate impact, continuous challenge

You'll work on challenging projects that have a meaningful impact on clients, industries, and societies from day one.
We'll ask you to challenge the norm and constantly strive to build something new to shape our firm and the world around us.
You'll be a contributing team member from the start, working with senior colleagues and clients to build trust-based relationships and deliver breakthrough impact.
Your experience will be diverse, with each project offering new opportunities to expand your toolkit and to team with Specialists who have deep subject-matter and technical expertise
You'll have the opportunity to travel frequently; whether this is internationally or in your home-city, no two weeks are ever the same.

Chart your course; we support the journey

This isn't a "two-year program" ? no artificial barriers stand in the way of your progression.
You'll have the opportunity to work across a wide variety of industries and capabilities and you can decide to specialize early or leave it until several years in.
You'll learn on the job via our apprenticeship model, supplemented by formal training. Much of your initial focus will be on research and analysis, and we'll support you in rapidly developing your communication, presentation, and client-management skills.
We care about you succeeding and you will be supported every step of the way. You will be mentored and coached by colleagues at each stage, from partners and other consultants to a dedicated "buddy," career adviser, and talent manager.
We believe inspired people with interesting lives make better consultants. We care deeply about sustainable work-life quality and provide for career flexibility with a variety of programs including sabbaticals, non-profit fellowships, and externships.

We hire you to be you

Our open, inclusive, and down-to-earth culture will enable you to bring your authentic self to work.
There's no corporate mold to fit and hierarchy doesn't get in the way.
Many of your colleagues will become life-long friends.
Job Responsibilities:
The Internship
The Intern Program is an internship for talented, highly motivated rising seniors.  As professional members of our firm:

Work in teams to solve high level business problems facing Fortune 1000 clients
Structure and carry out essential research and data management
Lead complex quantitative, strategic and financial analyses of corporations and businesses
Participate on a project team with significant exposure to senior leadership of the firm
Receive mentorship throughout the program
Participate in a week of training at the beginning of the summer
Receive broad exposure to a variety of industries including: Automotive, Aviation, Communications, Financial Services, Energy, Health & Life Sciences, Media, Retail, Surface Transportation and Technology.
Required Skills:
Qualifications
We look for initiative, intuition and creativity with a strong background in problem solving and analytics. We do not require a specific academic major or industry experience and we value extracurricular activities and evidence of leading an interesting and impactful life outside of studies/work. One of the best things we can do for our clients and ourselves is to recruit a diverse group of people who bring a broad range of strengths and backgrounds to their roles.

				- Theme - Information Science and Data Management 
				
			
				MATH - Applied Mathematics
				
			
				MATH - Computer Science
				
			
				MATH - Statistics and Actuarial Science
				
			
				SCI - Business

Job Summary:
About Us
 
Oliver Wyman is a global leader in management consulting. With offices in 60 cities across 29 countries, Oliver Wyman combines deep industry knowledge with specialized expertise in strategy, operations, risk management, and organization transformation. The firm has more than 5,000 professionals around the world who work with clients to optimize their business, improve their operations and risk profile, and accelerate their organizational performance to seize the most attractive opportunities. Our work is marked by exceptional impact for our clients and we have earned a reputation for quality work and that is why we represent half of the top 500 global companies.

Oliver Wyman is an equal opportunity employer and a wholly owned subsidiary of Marsh & McLennan Companies.
To learn more, please follow us on Facebook, LinkedIn or Twitter: @OliverWyman.
www.oliverwyman.com/careers
 

Oliver Wyman does not offer sponsorship for this position. Upon request candidates must be able to provide documented proof of their right to engage in employment in Canada and to work in the United States due to the nature of our work assignments.
Job Responsibilities:
About the Role

The Analyst (Intern) provides quantitative leverage to clients and consulting teams who are using the solutions to drive key strategic insights out of the analysis
Potential activities for the Analyst include: 

Project Delivery:

Collaborate in multi-disciplinary teams to delivery impactful client projects on various topics including, but not limited to, mergers and acquisitions, risk management, IT system integration, product designs
Synthesize the analysis to communicate business impacts to clients
Participate in client workshops and assignments
Provide technical support, and advise clients using the tool set


Model Design and Implementation:
	
Design financial projection models based on real world product specifications
Provide analytic expertise to consulting teams as the subject matter expert in financial modelling, risk management, as well as the software toolset
Augment project deliverables with models, calculation components, data analysis and data visualization


Application Design and Development:
	
The analyst will be expected to work with clients, consultants and the development team to facilitate the introduction of new features within the software platform. This includes submitting ideas for new features and improvements as well as the operational specification of specific features
The analyst will likely participate in different phases of the software development process (design, implementation, testing, documentation, client communication)
Participate in research projects to investigate and implement new analytic tools, methods and visualization techniques



Successful analysts have come from backgrounds in actuarial science, computer science, financial engineering, operations research, risk management, data analytics and data visualization, to name just a few. In addition to the quantitative skillset, the analyst must be a productive self-starter with very strong communication, organizational, and time management skills in order to thrive in this fast-moving environment.

The analyst will work with incredibly smart and thoughtful people, while getting experience with a variety of clients. The person will be empowered and have more autonomy in your role than almost anywhere else. At the same time, the person will develop the business skills and acumen to become the next generation of business leaders.

The team works side by side with senior executives to accelerate execution through a blend of behavioural and management approaches.

This role is a Specialist (Intern) in the Financial Services practice group of Oliver Wyman.

This role may require occasional travel.
Required Skills:
You should possess the following experience and qualifications:

In pursuit of an undergraduate degree (bachelor or equivalent) in the fields of actuarial science, statistics, finance, risk management, mathematics, business administration, science, engineering or similar quantitative fields
Intermediate Microsoft Office skills (Excel/Access/PowerPoint)
Introductory database management skills (data transfer and access, filtering, joining datasets)
Good understanding of financial economics (options and other derivatives), actuarial science and/or statistics, specifically regarding risk neutral valuation
Good understanding of life insurance products and markets
Introductory programming skills (with focus in implementing business logic) in some of the following: Python, R, C# (.net framework and .net core), or C++
Excellent organizational and process management skills
Excellent interpersonal skills; strong oral and written communication skills
The following experience and qualifications would be highly desirable:
Prior experience with the life insurance market, with emphasis in risk management and technologya
Advanced database management skills (data model design, query performance optimization)

Job Summary:
Student, Global Collaboration (Summer 2021 8 Month Term)

Why join us?
Are you looking to join a dynamic pension plan that embodies the strong values of its 500,000 members and is an industry leading global investor? If so, we would love to tell you our story.

At OMERS we put our people first and are proud to embrace the diversity of thought and leadership that comes from having locations in Toronto, London, New York, Singapore, Sydney and other major cities across North America and Europe. Our culture is truly one of a kind. We get stuff done, and have fun doing it! We take great pride in contributing to the communities where we live with an ever-constant eye to the global investment markets.

Reporting to the Manager, Global Collaboration, this task-based role will contribute to the overall enablement of virtual collaboration within the enterprise. The successful candidate will assist in covering support activities for our collaboration hardware and software.

This role will be based out of our main office in downtown Toronto. Limited travel is expected within the downtown Toronto Core. Standard expected hours of work are 9-5 Monday-Friday (This may adjust due to demand for services).

Testing, deploying, and supporting our enterprise standard collaboration solutions
Assisting with adoption initiatives for our enterprise standard collaboration solutions
Troubleshooting and logging issues that may occur during use, reporting/escalating to Sr. Analysts/Management as required
Overseeing account administration for our enterprise standard collaboration solutions
Setting up meetings (Turning on screens, connecting to WebEx, sharing screen, etc.)
Working with the Global Collaboration team to setup, operate, and tear-down event-related technology
Required Skills:
To succeed in this role, you have:

Experience with Cisco WebEx, Microsoft Teams, or other enterprise-level virtual collaboration suites
Experience with ServiceNow, or other enterprise-level ITSM solution
Hands on experience with Modern Smartphones/Devices
iPhones and iPads running iOS 13+
Samsung devices running Android 10.0+
Experience with Windows 10

Experience with Microsoft Office (Office 365 preferred)

Very strong customer service orientation

Job Summary:
Omnium is a boutique consulting and advisory firm specializing in analytics and data driven decision making in the CPG industry. Our offices are located in downtown San Francisco between Chinatown and the Financial District, and in Toronto's Liberty Village neighborhood.
 
Omnium interns become familiar with how multimillion dollar decisions are made in the CPG industry (the best interns get to help make these decisions too!), and learn state of the art methodologies for making good business decisions using data driven and mathematical techniques.
 
Omnium's work environment is rarely boring and there is always something to do! We spend our time serving our existing clients, researching new methods for applying mathematical techniques to the CPG industry, developing internal technology to help us work more efficiently, searching for new clients, and developing ourselves and our talent. We believe that work can be fun, and we make it a priority to socialize as a company (for example: playing board games together).
 
Omnium is a small company, and interns are treated like full-time members of our team.

This blog post details our approach to talent development and mentorship: https://www.omniumcpg.com/blog/2020/6/29/our-hands-on-approach-to-talent-development.
Job Responsibilities:
Omnium's internship program consists of the following:

A rigorous training program designed to teach the dynamics of the CPG industry, and bolster analytical thinking skills, data analysis skills, and mathematical modelling abilities.
A self-driven project helping Omnium solve problems at the frontier of our company. The project is the intern's opportunity to work on a problem that they find interesting, and contribute in a significant way to improving Omnium as a business.
Working on client deliverables.
Required Skills:
Must be studying in a STEM field.

Successful interns almost always possess the following characteristics:

Desire to develop strong skills in:
	
Analytical thinking
Data science, data analysis, and data manipulation
Mathematical modelling
Effectively communicating results to stakeholders and clients


Highly personable
Strong quantitative skills
Demonstrate a high degree of initiative
Mature and Professional
Targeted Degrees and Disciplines:
Targeted Clusters
			

		
		
			
				- Theme - Data Analytics, Statistical Analysis and Mathematical Optimization 
				
			
				- Theme - Information Science and Data Management 
				
			
				MATH - Applied Mathematics
				
			
				MATH - Combinatorics and Optimization
				
			
				MATH - Computing and Financial Management
				
			
				MATH - Pure Mathematics
				
			
				MATH - Statistics and Actuarial Science
				
			
				SCI - Physics

Job Summary:
At ON Semiconductor, we help improve lives with silicon chips and software solutions every day. Within the Medical Division, headquartered in Waterloo, we're developing leading-edge DSP's, biomedical semiconductor technology and support software that is used to help people hear, that keeps hearts beating, relieves chronic pain and helps people manage blood glucose levels. We invite you to join our innovative team and truly make a difference in someone's life.

The Hardware & Systems Development Group is looking for an enthusiastic, technical skilled individual to assist with the technical aspects of hardware and systems design for our core markets. These markets include next-generation medical applications (glucose monitors, diagnostic equipment, wireless body sensors), audiology (digital hearing aids), and audio (headsets, cell phones).

We're seeking innovative and creative employees, who can learn quickly, solve new problems, and who are interested in working with us to build their hardware and systems development skills.
Job Responsibilities:
The Work:
* Use leading edge RF test equipment such as vector network analyzer (VNA), spectrum analyzer, CMW500 call box to assess and characterize the RF performance of Bluetooth Low-Energy radio ICs and SIPs (System in Package) products. 
* Use antenna anechoic chamber with VNA, CMW and associated software to measure and assess antenna and overall radiated performance.
*Assess and characterize the performance of prototype ICs using lab equipment such as oscilloscopes, function generators, logic analyzers, and DC power analyzers.
* Assist in the design, development, and testing of a state-of-the-art low-power mixed-signal processors.
* Work on associated low-level firmware and interface software
* Participate in the design and development of hardware-based demonstration systems
Required Skills:
We're looking for candidates with:
* Interest in semiconductors (ASIC and ASSP)
* Interest in wireless/RF and audio technologies
* Interest or experience in embedded systems (FPGA, hardware, firmware, software)
* Interest or experience in hardware development, including PCBs (schematic design, layout, verification)
* Interest in extremely low-level programming (at the hardware level)
* Knowledge of microprocessor architecture, including memory maps, busses, interrupts, interfacing
* Knowledge of C/C++ and scripting languages including Python. Assembly language is an asset.
* Experience using standard lab equipment for testing, taking measurements, debugging systems
* Excellent written, verbal and presentation skills

At ON Semiconductor, www.onsemi.com you will have an opportunity to expand your horizons, work on exciting projects and make things happen!
Targeted Degrees and Disciplines:
Targeted Clusters
			

		
		
			
				- Theme - Computing: Hardware
				
			
				ENG - Electrical and Computer Engineering
				
			
				ENG - Mechanical and Mechatronics Engineering
				
			
				ENG - Software Engineering
				
			
				ENG - Systems Design and Biomedical Engineering
				
			
				MATH - Computer Science
Application Documents Required: University of Waterloo Co-op Work History,Résumé,Grade Report

Job Summary:
Firmware Developer
ON Semiconductor is a premier supplier of high performance silicon solutions for a diverse range of energy efficient electronics. The Signal Processing, Wireless, and Medical (SWM) Division's mission it to improve lives through the development of innovative semiconductor solutions. Our product portfolio includes wireless system-on-chips (SoCs), digital signal processing (DSP) systems, mixed-signal application specific integrated circuits (ASICs), miniaturized packaging, along with software development kits. We invite you to join our innovative team and truly make a difference in someone's life.

As part of the Wireless & DSP Firmware team, the work in this position will involve primarily developing embedded software solutions for ultra-low power wireless & audio DSP applications. The ideal candidate for this position has a passion for wireless technology and/or audio DSP, some real-world experience in embedded systems development, good communication skills and the ability to work well independently and within a team.

Job Summary:
About OnCall Health
OnCall is a leading platform for virtual healthcare. Used by thousands of healthcare providers across North America, OnCall enables clinicians with powerful tools to engage with their patients online. Currently in a high growth stage, there is never a more exciting time to join a startup. 

We are located in downtown Toronto at Queen and Spadina. We are currently operating fully remote but may consider a partial return to office sometime in the summer.

About the role
You'll have the opportunity to play a big role in a small team to develop high impact features that will be used by thousands of people across North America. As a co-op student, you will be treated the same as a full time employee, with the same range of responsibilities. You will work within an agile scrum team to build new features and maintain existing features used by tens of thousands of healthcare providers and patients. 

About the stack
Our backend is written in Python 3 and runs on Django, backed by a PostgresSQL database, as well as Redis.
Our frontend is written in ES6 and runs on React.
This web application is hosted on AWS using EC2, RDS, ECS, S3, and Elasticache.

This is a great role whether you are looking to expand your knowledge or learn a new skill.
Job Responsibilities:
Responsibilities
- Work closely with the engineering team to design and implement technical solutions
- Bring new ideas, solutions, and feedback to the team
- Improve our code base by refactoring, optimizing, and keeping up to date with the latest methods and frameworks
- Help us meet the technical challenges of global expansion such as load management, legal compliance, and localization
- Write fast, efficient, and high quality code that will help us deliver great value to our customers
- Test your work thoroughly and have a low tolerance for bugs
Required Skills:
Required:
- Strong computer science fundamentals and database design
- Past experience in software development (professional or personal projects)
- Some experience with Python and Javascript ES6
- Understanding of web networking including HTTP and RESTful design
- Have a QA mindset and know different testing strategies
- Great work ethic and motivation to learn and improve

Nice to have:
- Experience with Django or React
- Understanding of Cloud Infrastructure (AWS, Google Cloud, etc)

Job Summary:
At Onlia, we're working to help make Canada a safer place. We're doing this by providing digital products that help people stay safer and more protected: from all-online insurance that's changing the industry for the better, to our mobile app that rewards safe-driving habits.
 
This is your opportunity to join a lean, fast-paced team that's disrupting the Canadian insurance industry. We're fresh out of the start-up phase, have a foothold in the market and are growing fast. Here, you'll be in the position to take a significant role in driving Onlia's success by providing a best-in-class experience for our customers and community.
 
We're looking for a bright and enthusiastic student to join our Marketing and Communications team. Our successful candidate will have a strong mind for strategic communications, with experience drafting and editing public relations materials, social content, and managing marketing campaigns. As a member of the Marketing and Communications team, your role at Onlia will be to work with content editors, marketing analysts, designers, customer support, and external agencies to help execute clear, compelling and results-driven marketing and communications campaigns. Supporting our overall marketing strategy, you'll be working on numerous digital properties and channels, so being versatile and able to adapt messaging to fit the format is a must.
 
Sound alright? Keep reading!

Onlia's mission: Together, making Canada safer.
Onlia offers innovative digital insurance and mobile technology products to the Canadian market. Onlia's mission is to create a community around making Canada a safer place, and to provide tools and motivation to facilitate safer behaviours. Launched in 2018, Onlia is a joint venture between Achmea, the largest insurance group of the Netherlands, and Fairfax Financial, a Canadian-based financial holding company. Using proprietary and award-winning technology, Onlia is rethinking the way Canadians approach safety and insurance.
 
We are here to transform the Canadian insurance industry and are building a team of heavy hitters to make that a reality. We work collaboratively in a fast-paced and agile environment. Every member of our team is empowered to take ownership of their role, and to assist in the build of a best-in-class experience for our customers.
Job Responsibilities:
Key Accountabilities:
 
KA 1 - Social Media
Assist with executing the Onlia social media editorial calendar and administrative functions across all social channels: Facebook, Twitter, Pinterest, Instagram, YouTube, etc., including drafting and posting compelling social content designed to drive engagement and traffic to Onlia.ca. Leverage social listening insights for community management and content recommendations; deliver insights on content and channel performance; and, provide recommendations for content and channel optimization.
 
KA 2 - Public Relations
Support the Communications Lead with reviewing and revising key messages for brand marketing campaigns; liaising with the customer support team on messaging for key initiatives; executing social giveaways and contests; and identifying new influencers, media, and journalists for lists building.
 
KA 3 - Content
Manage review and approval of content with key stakeholders, ensuring publishing timelines are reflected in the editorial calendar. Contribute to ongoing content brainstorming sessions and assist with execution of production for internal content franchises.

KA 4 - Marketing Acquisition
Provide administrative and project management support of marketing acquisition initiatives in collaboration with the external advertising agency, including: Liaising with design team on creative refresh / revisions; Digital Marketing A/B tests; Tracking and managing ad units in-market; liaising with Content Team for on-site personalization strategy; and version control for cross-channel acquisition ads.
Required Skills:
Competencies & Qualifications

Here's what we look for in a successful Marketing and Communications Co-op Student at Onlia:

Currently a third- or fourth-year student pursuing a degree in marketing, communications, or other similar program of study
Razor-sharp attention to detail
Excellent marketing and communications writing skills
Digitally-savvy: Ability to work with our editorial calendar and marketing tools like Trello and Google Analytics
Knowledge of social media channel strategy and best practices
Excels working within a cross-departmental team using strong interpersonal skills
Thrives in a fast-paced, collaborative, creative environment
Ability to manage multiple priorities and deadlines

Be sure to include a link to where we can see some of your previous work.

Job Summary:
At Onlia, we are building a modern inspiring environment with great opportunities in which people take responsibility and ownership. We trust and empower our people, minimizing any unnecessary rules and escalation. Our teams work across functions towards common end-to-end goals, in an agile and less bureaucratic way. If this sounds like a culture you want to be part of then, continue reading.
 
Our success depends on our people, productivity and procedures.  Our culture is based on shared success, finding simplicity in everything, making an impact and being open and honest in everything we do.  During the co-op placement the Software Developer will be reporting into our Mobile Architect and work closely with our QA who are both part of the day-2-day mobile development team.
 
The ideal team member is someone that is flexible, thrives in a team environment, has a passion for detail and ensuring the integrity of the business. Someone extremely interested in new developments (digital, cloud, agile/scrum), wants to be part to a high-tech insurance start up, is a multidisciplinary thinker, team player and is willing to challenge the traditional rules.
 
Onlia's mission: Together, making Canada safer.
Onlia offers innovative digital insurance and mobile technology products to the Canadian market. Onlia's mission is to create a community around making Canada a safer place, and to provide tools and motivation to facilitate safer behaviours. Launched in 2018, Onlia is a joint venture between Achmea, the largest insurance group of the Netherlands, and Fairfax Financial, a Canadian-based financial holding company. Using proprietary and award-winning technology, Onlia is rethinking the way Canadians approach safety and insurance.
 
We are here to transform the Canadian insurance industry and are building a team of heavy hitters to make that a reality. We work collaboratively in a fast-paced and agile environment. Every member of our team is empowered to take ownership of their role, and to assist in the build of a best-in-class experience for our customers.
 
Your team
In your day to day work, you'll be part of our mobile-app team where you will work on both the back-end and front-end of our application. You will be building out our strategy and framework for test automation. We aim to do that both on the apps themselves (iOS and Android) and on the back-end API. To be able to achieve that, you will work closely with your fellow team members such as mobile developers, QA and design. It is a small, multidisciplinary team which works in a high-pace agile setup. We aim to release new features to production every month.
Job Responsibilities:
Key Accountabilities:
 
KA 1 Design and develop a framework for front-end test automation. We will use BrowserStack to execute the front-end tests, they still need to be developed and this needs to be integrated in our build pipelines eventually.  

KA 2 Design and develop back-end automation tests, focussing on the API. The framework needs to be easily extendible and integrated in the build pipelines eventually. 

KA 3 Learn to work closely with teams ranging from front-end, backend and design. You'll be part of all the 'regular' development processes we have. Building new features from the design process till releasing them to our users. The team works completely scrum based, where you'll have the opportunity to take part in this process.

KA 4 Track all projects with Git VCS. Learn how it is to work with multiple developers on the same code base, do code reviews, etc.

KA 5 Recommend new solutions and upgrades in alignment with strategic plans and business requirements.

KA 6 Document application development accordingly. Documentation is an important part of the development process, but it does not have to be boring. We work with tools like Swagger to make sure our API documentation is always up to date and can easily be consumed by the mobile developers for example.
 
KA 7 Testing: you'll write unit tests for your own code and coordinate with the QA in your team on how the new feature needs to be tested. As you'll work in a multidisciplinary team, you might also test features of your other colleagues now and then.
Required Skills:
Qualifications and Competencies

Currently 3rd or 4th year student enrolled in a bachelor's degree in Computer Science or Software Engineering
Some experience with JavaScript
Some experience with Kotlin and/or Python
Good communication skills, and able to collaborate in a dynamic development environment

Onlia welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

Job Title:
NEW
									



										Robotics and Automation Software Developer
Job Summary:
Robotics and Automation Software Developer








Are you passionate about software development and robotics, and would you like to put these skills to use in industry to drive real world machinery to manufacture real world parts?
Are you driven to discover software solutions to factory automation problems that factory automation companies tell you can't be done?
A welcoming and tight-knit development team, and technical challenges and high responsibility with job stability and healthy project funding. This is what ODI can offer you.
ODI has been a leader in utilizing modern software development technologies and processes typically found in mature software development firms, with robotics and machine vision approaches you'd expect to see in University labs, and automated metal forming for which we have our own unique IP. The team is firing on all pistons developing software and hardware solutions using some of the latest technologies - ROS, custom built robots and automation equipment, robotic metal forming, and perception using vision cameras and blue laser scanners. We have been awarded patents and have others pending for this work. The multidisciplinary team is built up of a combination of experienced engineers and talented career starters in the fields of mechatronics, software, mechanical, and electrical who are in constant collaboration towards a common goal. Coop students have always been a component of this team, and we have been hiring and mentoring students for decades. A factory and machine shop are within the same building in which to develop and test solutions.
The team is currently in need of a talented software developer who is passionate about problem solving, advanced software, and machine automation. There are opportunities to work directly with the automated equipment, and learning on the job is a must.
* Note As a result of Covid-19, it is expected that most or all of this role will be completed remote. ODI will provide you with the required computer equipment.

Likely Projects Include:

Designing and developing new controls and automation software in the form of add-on modules to existing software using C#, continuous improvement of existing software, and testing the software on automated machinery in a factory environment.
Projects sometimes require use of ROS/C++ and changes to PLC logic.

Job Summary:
Are you interested in using machine learning to predict patient outcomes in cancer? 
In using network-based approaches for integration of clinical, genetic, genomic, imaging data to find predictive biomarkers? 
Are you interested in a work term at a world-class research institute using basic and translational projects to solve cancer?

Dr. Shraddha Pai works in the field of precision medicine, the goal of which is to match patients to the most effective treatment based on their profile, with minimal side effects. This co-op position will help set up a workflow for predictive modelling for the lab. The result will be a system that can perform on-demand high-throughput prediction of clinical outcomes for datasets profiling several cancer types, such as data from The Cancer Genome Atlas and International Cancer Genome Consortium. This work term will provide an opportunity to implement the pipeline as well as run it on existing datasets to evaluate the predictive power of clinical genomic data. There may be opportunities for other genotype-phenotype analyses, including genome-wide association tests and pathway-based interpretation.
 
About
---------
Dr. Pai's group focuses on computational medicine and in epigenetics of disease, with a passion for translational research. Most recently, Dr. Pai led the development of netDx, a general-purpose patient classifier algorithm that integrates heterogeneous patient data into a single model to predict clinical outcome. It adapts a recommender system model similar to that used by Netflix ("find movies like this one") to precision medicine ("find patients like non-responders"), and uses prior knowledge of cellular pathways to organize genomic data. Dr. Pai started an independent research group at the Ontario Institute for Cancer Research (OICR) in Jan 2021 and is looking to build infrastructure for predictive modeling that will improve cancer outcomes.
Learn more at http://shraddhapai.com

OICR is a collaborative, not-for-profit research institute accelerating the development of new cancer research discoveries for patients around the world while maximizing the economic benefit of this research for the people of Ontario. Learn more at https://oicr.on.ca/
Job Responsibilities:
* Develop software pipeline for prediction of clinical outcome by data integration of multiple patient data types, including clinical and multi-omic data:
     * Pipeline will include software for data exploration, and Python/R-based machine learning libraries. Software will be available for standalone jobs using Docker, as well as a pipeline on a High Performance Computing cluster (e.g. SciNet, OICR internal).
      * Apply the workflow to a selected subset of cancers from The Cancer Genome Atlas - Clinical Data Resource (TCGA-CDR), a multi-omic profile of 33 cancers, along with clinical endpoints. 
* There may be an opportunity to apply the pipeline on datasets arising from collaborations with research groups within OICR or the wider community.
Required Skills:
* Programming experience of 3+ years (e.g. C++, R, Java, Python)
* Ability to develop and run code in Unix environment
* Ability to write simple, clearly-organized, maintainable and documented code
* R programming an asset
* Python programming an asset

Job Summary:
The Global Alliance for Genomics and Health (GA4GH) is an international open-science organization building genomic data standards for the benefit of human health and medicine. Formed in 2013, GA4GH brings together 500+ leading organizations working in healthcare, research, patient advocacy, life science, and information technology to create frameworks and standards to enable the responsible, voluntary, and secure sharing of genomic and health-related data.

GA4GH is supported by an international staff based at five sites around the globe, including the Ontario Institute for Cancer Research (OICR) in Toronto. As the organization grows and gains more support from the global genomics community, the GA4GH is building its in-house technical team. This role will involve the development of reference implementations of open source technical standards and/or supporting applications. The reference implementations will help international genomic data projects implement GA4GH APIs in order to improve health outcomes. Other application plans include APIs and tools that will shorten development times and bring greater cohesion to GA4GH Work Stream processes and outputs.

As a member of the GA4GH team you will meet and work with leading international software engineers in the area of genomics.

NOTE: Given the current COVID-19 pandemic, this is a remote position until further notice.
Job Responsibilities:
- Develop reference implementations for approved GA4GH technical standards, including APIs and new bioinformatics file formats.
- Develop support applications to bring greater cohesion to the ecosystem of GA4GH standards, such as testing platforms and documentation generators.
- Join project calls with international team members to gather functional requirements for new implementations, and provide updates and demonstrations.
- Use version control (i.e. Github) and continuous integration (i.e. Travis CI) to maintain your implementation's source code, track issues, and perform automated testing
- Write clear, comprehensive documentation of your software, so that other developers can readily make use of it in their own projects.
Required Skills:
Required Skills

- Currently pursuing a university degree in computer sciences, software engineering or equivalent
- Experience with Java and/or Python is a must
- Proficient in working with common structured data formats, including JSON and XML
- Proficient with source control (git) and collaborative project management platforms (GitHub, Slack)
- Prior experience with automated software testing
- Excellent communication skills (listening, written and verbal), both in articulating your ideas and gathering input from a variety of collaborators in remote settings
- Resourceful team player who excels at building trusting relationships with customers and colleagues
- Knowledge of bioinformatics/cancer genomics or experience in an international project is an asset but not essential

Recommended Skills

- Experience developing RESTful APIs
- Knowledge of Continuous Integration (CI) philosophy and tools (Travis, Jenkins, etc) is an asset
- Knowledge of the OpenAPI Specification to define and describe APIs is an asset
- Knowledge of a server-side web development framework (Flask, Spring Boot, Express, etc.) is an asset

Required Skills: Personal Attributes

- Inspired by challenging problems;
- Independent and self-motivated;
- Capable of managing effort across multiple parallel projects; 
- Thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic environment;
- Collaborative.

Job Summary:
This is a position in the Informatics department at the Ontario Institute for Cancer Research. We seek a Software Developer to join the dockstore.org team developing and maintaining cutting edge open-source applications for sharing and executing analysis workflows in cloud compute environments such as AWS and OpenStack. The applications will be used by researchers around the world to process and interpret vast amounts of cancer genomic data and to apply this understanding to new paradigms for diagnosing and treating cancer.
dockstore.org is a platform that was created in response to the many challenges faced during the PCAWG study (Pan-Cancer Analysis of Whole Genomes). Today, it is a repository of scientific workflows jointly maintained by OICR and UCSC (University of California, Santa Cruz). Workflows are described using popular workflow languages such as CWL, WDL, and Nextflow with their dependencies distributed in Docker images.
Software developers working on dockstore.org are independent, creative, and are often asked to learn and/or work with workflow languages, cloud technologies, and Docker.
The codebase for dockstore.org is available at https://github.com/dockstore
Job Responsibilities:
Create RESTful API/web applications, desktop clients
Work with AWS, Elasticsearch, Docker, JavaScript/TypeScript, Java, and PostgreSQL
Create and maintain cloud-based computational workflows using virtualization technologies such as Docker and languages such as Common Workflow Language
Create and maintain distributed cloud service infrastructure
Research solutions to bugs and other software performance issues
Creating useful and informative visualizations
Required Skills:
Create RESTful API/web applications, desktop clients
Assist in developing code - including reuse of standard elements - to create prototypes.
Research solutions to bugs and other software performance issues
Create useful and informative graphs and visualizations
Create unit tests and integration tests when implementing new features and fixing bugs

Organization: Ontario Ministry of Agriculture, Food and Rural Affairs
Job Summary: To provide support and assistance to the GIS and Land Resource Specialist team in the Resources Information and Business Services Unit of OMAFRA's Environmental Management Branch.  Support and assistance will include operating GIS systems and applications, producing specific GIS related products for Ministry clients, automating processes through scripting, and working with GIS data in support of unit and branch initiatives and priorities. There will be a focus on agricultural and rural land-use planning and agricultural systems mapping in support of land-use planning and policy development.
Job Responsibilities:
Under the direction of the Resources Information and Business Services unit manager  and with the support of Senior GIS and Land Resource staff.: 
1. Assist, as needed, GIS and soil information staff on a project basis and perform project duties such as: 
a. Prepare reports, maps, and models for program and policy needs. 
b. Use software such as ArcGIS, AGOL, QGIS, or R, to analyze, compile, and modify geographic information to satisfy staff mapping or information requests. 
c. Digitize, geo-reference, vectorize and edit digital and hard copy mapping information to create, enhance and maintain the ministry's corporate datasets and web materials.
d. Create documentation for GIS analysis and reports that provide methodologies and logical work flows to be used as knowledge management tools 
e. Assist in the automation of GIS analysis and workflow process through modifying or creating models, using tools such as ArcGIS modelbuilder, or by means of various scripting languages that are compatible with ESRI ArcGIS software. 

2. Assist in the maintenance of Ministry GIS datasets by: 
a. Using corporate editing tools to edit spatial and non-spatial data. 
b. Catalogue, document, and archive project information using corporate information management protocols (Metadata Management Tool) to inform stakeholders of changes to the ministries datasets. 

3. Follow, where required, corporate policies, standards and procedures, recommending improvements/changes as necessary to ensure staff efficiency and quality work products.
Required Skills:
Knowledge 
- Knowledge of operating systems (e.g. Windows), database and spreadsheets (e.g. Microsoft Office Suite), GIS products (e.g. ArcGIS Suite, Esri Suite, QGIS, R), in order to operate the GIS facility to corporate standards and ensure data integrity, security and availability.  
- Knowledge of standards for data collection, conversion, manipulation, storage and maintenance, libraries, catalogues, and system backups. 
- Knowledge of GPS systems and GPS data collection principles and the incorporation of conversion issues when using data obtained from outside agencies.  
- Knowledge of structured data analysis, database design, programming languages and application software.
- Knowledge of remote sensing data and imagery and image analysis techniques.   

Skills 
- Position requires analytical and problem solving skills   
- Position requires exploration, analysis and evaluative skills 
- Position requires communication and evaluative skills to be able to, for example, assess user requirements and translate these into defined products.  
- Position requires communication skills both written and verbal to prepare various reports, documents and standards and to liaise with a wide variety of internal and external contacts. 
- Position requires prioritizing own workload to ensure internal and external client needs are being serviced in a timely manner. 
- Position requires team working skills to be able to communicate and work effectively within a team environment. 

Freedom of Action 
- Position works within the procedural controls and guidelines of Ministry and Provincial policies, directives and established procedures in dealing with GIS operating systems, maintenance and support, data standards and database management and information access e.g. resale copyright license agreement. 
 -Position refers to supervisor unusual or potentially contentious issues.  
- Position also refers matters not covered by established procedures (such as not being able to meet required deadlines, data gaps, etc.) to project lead 
- Position works semi-independent to keep the operations running smoothly, escalating service support to supervisor as situation requires.  
- Position is subject to review or monitoring for progress and results.

Job Summary: The Industrial Economics Branch (IEB) in the Office of Economic Policy division at the Ontario Ministry of Finance carries out policy analysis and provides advice to the Minister of Finance and the Government of Ontario on a wide range of microeconomic issues affecting economic growth and job creation in the province, and the competitiveness of Ontario's various industrial and financial services sectors and regions. The Branch provides an opportunity to work closely with staff on challenging industrial and regional economic development issues in an informal and supportive environment.
Job Responsibilities:
The Sectoral Economics Unit is seeking an enthusiastic self-starter with a strong background in economics. The unit is responsible for economic analysis related to the major industrial sectors in Ontario, such as manufacturing, automotive, financial services, entertainment and creative cluster, and small businesses. The unit also provides analytical support and policy advice on other issues and trends that affect economic growth, such as carbon pricing policy, international trade agreements, and natural resources and environmental policies. 

The Research Analyst will contribute to the work of branch economists and policy advisors by:

- monitoring current events of interest to economic and industrial policy
- undertaking secondary and primary research (where possible) and communicating research findings 
- reviewing, summarizing and synthesizing economic and related literature
- compiling, analyzing and summarizing industrial and economic development data
- producing charts or slides to be used in documents and presentations
- developing economic analysis and policy analysis skills
- undertaking other duties as assigned

Candidates should have a strong academic background in economics and demonstrate strong skills in research, analysis, and written and oral communication.

Students specializing in Economics at the senior undergraduate and graduate levels are encouraged to apply. Knowledge of statistical software such as STATA, R and SQL would be an asset. Remote working is availiable pending on the development of Covid-19.

Job Summary:
The Ontario Financing Authority (OFA) is responsible for the borrowing, investment and financial risk management of the Province of Ontario.

Investor Relations is a part of the Capital Markets division at the OFA. It supports the Province's borrowing program by building relationships with investors and keeping the fixed-income community apprised of the Province's economic and fiscal outlook and its borrowing program in order for investors to make informed purchase decisions about Ontario bonds.

The Investor Relations group is seeking a highly motivated Research Analyst for a 4 or 8-month work term who is looking to learn more about debt capital markets, investor relations as well as economic and political developments in Ontario and how they are reflected in the market.

The health and wellbeing of our employees remains of the utmost importance, as such, the OFA will operate as a distributed workforce (a combination of remote work and on-site work) until it is deemed safe to return to the workplace at full capacity. We are committed to supporting all staff and students during this unprecedented time. Job Summary:
This position is with the Ontario Financing Authority (OFA), an agency of the Ontario Ministry of Finance that manages the Province's debt and borrowing program.

This position is with the Credit Analysis and Rating Relations unit of the Risk Control Division at the OFA. This unit oversees and develops strategies in support of Ontario's relationship with credit rating agencies. It is also responsible for monitoring and providing analysis on the credit quality of Ontario's existing and potential counterparties to manage credit risk.
Job Responsibilities:
Under the direction of a Senior Analyst, the Research Assistant will:
- Monitor the credit ratings and credit quality of Ontario's financial counterparties and provide timely summaries and assessments of rating developments based on reports from Moody's, S&P and DBRS, other financial media sources e.g. Bloomberg and Reuters and undertake other independent research.
- Maintain a credit ratings database related to Ontario's borrowing and risk management programs and maintain on an ongoing basis a summary report of ratings and rating changes for senior officials.
- Perform credit analysis to assess the credit quality of domestic and international banks, corporations, other financial institutions and other jurisdictions relevant to Ontario's financing program.
- Compile credit exposure statistics related to Ontario's financial counterparties for inclusion in reports for senior management and the OFA's Board of Directors.
- Support the daily collateral processes with respect to the OFA's financial instruments by checking exposures against policy limits and informing the trading desk of daily collateral requirements.
- Produce a weekly written summary of economic and credit related research for discussion at the OFA risk management committee.
- Assist with requests from rating agencies relating to Ontario's credit ratings, debt composition and risk management policies.
- Respond to requests from within the OFA in addition to other Ministries and government agencies for credit-related research, including current credit ratings on various issuers (e.g., financial institutions, provinces, sovereigns).
- Assist with the preparation of the Province's annual post-budget rating review meetings with the rating agencies.
Required Skills: General knowledge of finance and financial instruments. Understanding of domestic and international capital markets, and the government budget process. Strong report writing skills. Mature with strong interpersonal and communication skills. Ability to carry out multiple assignments within tight time frames.'

variety of systems and applications in automating the business operations of the Ontario Ministry

of Health and Long-Term Care in the areas of Financial  Planning, Budgeting and Forecasting,

Health Statistic Analysis, Health Results Dashboarding and Scorecarding, Healthcare Case

Management, and Online Funding Applications.

 The majority of these systems are developed using either Java enterprise standards (Java EE) in

IBM Rational Application Developer (RAD) or Eclipse IDE, or Dot Net, C#, ASP.NET via Microsoft

Visual Studio, following the best practices in the software development lifecycle process

including Agile, SCRUM, and other Ontario Public Services (OPS) corporate standards. The

applications are using relational database or data warehouse based on either Oracle or Microsoft

SQL Server. Different data sources are collected and processed using the Informatica ETL process

to load into a number of data mart/data lake instances, and the dimensional data are consumed

using the Cognos Business Intelligence tools to generate various types of reports, scorecards,

and dashboards for business operation analysis, planning, and decision support.

 Under the supervision and guidance of the Project Manager, Project Team Lead and Senior System

Analysts and Developers, the selected student will learn the industry standard software

development process and participate in a number of projects to learn and to grow, using the Java

and Java Enterprise Edition, or Dot Net, C#, ASP.Net, Visual Studio IDE tool, MS Power Platform,

Database tools, in combination with the newest cutting edge technologies in MongoDB, Cosmo DB,

Express JS,  React JS, Node JS (MERN Stack) on Cloud Comupting platforms such as Microsoft Azure,

Amazon AWS, Pivotal Cloud Foundry, DevOps, CI/CD, Machine Learning, Artificial Intelligence AI,

etc.

 - System Design

 - Operation Support
