Job Summary:
The Ontario Ministry of Infrastructure, Infrastructure Analytics Unit, requires one (1) Research Analyst to join a team of professionals engaged in infrastructure policy development for the province.
 
Profile of Hiring Organization
 
This is an exciting time to be part of a new ministry that will guide Ontario's largest investment in public infrastructure in the province's history, about $160 billion over 12 years. The ministry will develop the province's next 10-year capital plan and lead the province's negotiations with the federal government on new infrastructure agreements. As well, we guide the province's Community Hubs initiative and help integrate the province's commitments in the Climate Change Action Plan into the province's infrastructure plan.
 
The Infrastructure Analytics Unit (IAU), within the Infrastructure Research Branch is responsible for infrastructure economics, research and analytics, information and database management, and tool building.
 
We're putting a lot of effort into modernizing our understanding of its infrastructure assets, infrastructure planning and project tracking. We champion data management and help to facilitate understanding of projects outside of the Province's direct jurisdiction (municipal infrastructure for example). Infrastructure belongs on a map so that's where we put it: https://www.ontario.ca/page/building-ontario
 
The position provides an opportunity to work on challenging economic and analytical issues as part of a team in a friendly and fast-paced environment. The position is located near College Park in downtown Toronto.
 
All applicants should include a resume and academic transcript, as well as a cover letter indicating why they are interested in the position
Required Skills:
Applicants should be familiar with common office software (e.g., spreadsheets). Effective oral and written communication skills are important.


Expertise in SQL, knowledge of geographic information systems (GIS), skills in computer programming (VB.Net) would be considered assets. Opportunities may exist in desktop software development (VB.Net), software testing, and documentation of technical systems for the interested candidate.
 
This position may be of interest to students in the academic disciplines of Economics, Finance, Computer Science, Math, Urban Planning, Business Administration, Geography, and others.
 

Economic \ Financial Analysis
	
comparing our data to international measures

inter-jurisdictional scans

visualizations

Organization: Ontario Ministry of Municipal Affairs and Housing
Job Summary:
Interested in the inner workings of policy integration and collaboration within the Government of Ontario?  Looking for insight into the issues that matter most to executives in government today?  Consider this opportunity with the PERL Secretariat, located in the Intergovernmental Relations and Partnerships Branch at the Ministry of Municipal Affairs and Housing. 

The PERL Policy Cluster is a peer network representing 13-member ministries with related mandates in Planning, Environment, Resource, Land use and municipal governance (PERL).  It provides a collaborative leadership model to support integrated decision-making on policy initiatives that have multi-sectoral impacts.  The cluster works through executive level committees at the Deputy Minister, Assistant Deputy Minister, and Director to support horizontal policy development and integration.  Executives engage in strategic discussions of pressing issues and current policy matters while the PERL Secretariat provides administrative leadership and executive support.  The Secretariat also leads and facilitates multi-ministry research and priority projects.
Job Responsibilities:
In this role, you will:

Support agenda management for executive committees, including topic identification with members, long-range planning, and ensureing meetings run smoothly; 
Conduct outreach, research and analysis to support priority tracking and forecasting, a regional monitoring program, and ad hoc projects as needed; and
Support clients through regular communication, outreach and SharePoint sites.
Required Skills:
Research Skills:

You can provide research support to projects and branch initiatives
You can gather and analyze information to support the development of recommendations and resolutions to issues
You are interested in acquiring direct knowledge of the Ontario Government's policy processes

Oral and Written Communication Skills:

You can prepare various documents (i.e., presentations, reports, summaries, etc.)
You can clearly and concisely communicate information and recommendations  

Interpersonal and Teamwork Skills:

You can establish and maintain effective working relationships with colleagues and stakeholders at all levels
You can participate in and contribute to committees and projects 

Project Management Skills:

You can plan, organize, and manage multiple tasks and projects with competing deadlines 

Judgement:

You can identify contentious issues and recommend solutions
You can recognize complex issues needing to be referred to senior staff 

Computer Skills:

You are proficient in common software applications to draft documents and reports, prepare presentations, conduct analysis, and perform research on the internet

Organization: Ontario Ministry of the Attorney General
Job Summary:
The Office of the Public Guardian and Trustee (OPGT) is responsible for protecting the property and personal interests of mentally incapable adults who have no one else to help them, investigating allegations of abuse of mentally incapable adults, protecting the public's interest in charities, searching for heirs, investing perpetual care funds and dealing with dissolved corporations. The OPGT has more than 450 employees located in six offices throughout the province.

In this role you will be part of a small team working with senior resources to maintain and enhance an integrated and complex Client management application which is a critical application to support the business users to accomplish the above. Some of the technologies used within this application are;  .Net, C#,  database query language( SQL)  and Oracle tools.

Assigned projects can vary from writing new code to help automate a business process, to perform data validation, or optimize performance of an existing business process, and as needed debugging existing business applications/programs to find and resolve defects.     

You may also work on tasks related to the enterprise data warehouse. These tasks include performing data analysis, database programming, and writing reports using SSRS to extract and present information. 

What will you gain ?

In this position you will develop your skills in object-oriented programming, (.NET,  C#), and database query language( SQL), and Oracle.  You will be able to contribute to the project work on innovative business applications that play an essential role in supporting, automating and optimizing the work performed by the stakeholders of the OPGT.

When will you work ?  

The day is 8 hours with 1 - ¼ hr break and 1/2 hr lunch break for a 7 ¼ hour work day.  The morning start time is flexible, and may be any time between 7:30 and 8:45 am.
Job Responsibilities:
What will you do?

Your role as SSO / Programmer will involve participating in new and ongoing programming projects supported by a senior resource.  You will work as part of the small team or independently to complete project assignments to meet deadlines and schedules with code that is tested to be error free. 

Some tasks will require that you to review existing code, find defects and resolve, or add or enhanced application functionality which must be done by adhering to the existing programming standards and structures.   
  
What do you need to be successful in this role?

This role requires the candidate to have object-oriented programming experience in .NET,  C#, along with a good understanding of Structured Query Language SQL for the development of database queries. 

A basic understanding of data models, relational mapping, and familiarity with Oracle & SQL Server databases would be ideal.

Here are some examples of projects previous students have contributed to/completed: 
 
- An address validation feature.  The project required the use of PGTed - an internal application.  The backend was written in C# with a hook-up to the Google Geolocation API that could validate the addresses.
- Improved the data warehouse ETL process by analysing and rewriting queries to optimize performance, creating ER diagrams to reflect the changes, and building SSRS reports from the data warehouse.
- Integrating APIs and libraries using .Net/C# to perform data validation in a mission critical application used daily by OPGT staff.
Required Skills:
Who is an ideal candidate ? 

Someone who is self motivated, enjoys challenges, learns new technologies quickly, works well under pressure, is a good team player, and who is not afraid to voice their opinion on what a software resolution may look like.   

The skills that would be an asset:

- Programming using .Net and C#
- Ability to be a good team player or work independently as necessary
- Ability to complete tasks in an accurate, and timely manner with minimal supervision and defect free
- Being a self-starter and possess the ability to manage multiple concurrent tasks
- SSRS/RDL - Familiarity with SQL Server reporting services (SSRS) would be beneficial
- Basic understanding of ANSI SQL, T-SQL, & PLSQL - familiarization with the database programming and artefacts

Organization: Ontario Ministry of the Environment, Conservation and Parks
Job Summary: The Permit to Take Water and Brownfields Unit, and in particular the Permit To Take Water ("PTTW") team, is looking for a scientifically/technically oriented self-motivated student who is interested in joining our team to help deliver the PTTW program. The PTTW team is recently re-organized group formed to centralize the Provincial permitting process and is looking for assistance in the delivery of the program that includes assisting technical and administrative staff in their review of PTTW applications, reviewing guidance materials and existing operation procedures and undertaking consultation of proposed water takings.
Job Responsibilities:
- Assisting hydrogeologists and surface water specialists with the technical review of PTTW applications, including review of conceptual site models, water taking needs, potential impacts, and monitoring & mitigation programs

- Assisting Water Evaluators with municipal/conservation authority and indigenous/first nations consultation process for proposed water takings

- Review and address of comments posted to the Environmental Registry of Ontario related to proposed water takings

- Working with Program Support Staff, participate in the review of existing website and guidance materials for external stakeholders, and preparation of standard operating procedures for MECP staff

- Providing support, as required, with urgent requests from the Assistant Deputy Minister's Office, the Deputy Minister's Office and the Minister's Office

- Other duties as assigned
Required Skills:
- Course work in hydrology, hydrogeology, geochemistry and geology would be an asset 

- Familiarity with environmental legislation, policies, procedures and guidelines which includes the Water Taking and Transfer - Ontario Regulation 387/04 and Section 34 of the Ontario Water Resources Act, R.S.O. 1990.

- Familiarity with principles and practices of geology, hydrology and hydrogeology 

- Fluent with computer software applications such as word processing (i.e., Word) and spreadsheets (i.e., Excel)

- Works well with others and also able to work independently

- Ability to compose written materials

- Project management skills

Job Summary: This is a unique opportunity for students to gain experience at the one of the largest pet nutrition research facilities in North America. Our newly renovated facility boasts some of the most progressive animal housing and welfare standards for animal research worldwide. Students with a passion for animals and an interest in cats and dogs will gain valuable experience learning the protocols and regimens practiced at a top-class research facility. Our past employees have gone on to become veterinarians, graduate researchers, and the like, with rewarding careers at universities, government institutions and in the private sector.
Job Responsibilities:
This position includes any combination of the following tasks:

Daily maintenance of animal housing, animal care, feeding, grooming and social enrichment for dogs and cats. 
Assisting with weighing of animals, health monitoring, data collection & processing of samples (minimally invasive procedures only).  
Weighing and preparing food for animals.
Monitoring and maintaining electronic feeding stations for cats.

Successful applicants will experience the responsibilities and rewards of joining a collegial team that achieves meaningful real world research.
 
***Please include in your application any past experience you have had with animals and a brief explanation about why you are interested in this position.***
Required Skills:
Must have previous experience working with animals, even if that is a pet at home - Please include this information in your cover letter.
Attention to detail and time management skills are a must.

Job Title:
NEW
									



										Intern -Internal Strategy Consultant, Infrastructure & Natural Resources ( 4 month contract)
Job Summary:
The opportunity
May 2021 - August 2021

Are you curious to learn more about how we create value working with our global portfolio of companies? Do you want to solve real problems by bringing a new point of view?  Do you thrive in a fast-paced working environment? If so, join Ontario Teachers' Infrastructure & Natural Resources (INR) group and work in the Value Creation and Analytics team. We are looking for dedicated self-starters who share our passion for value creation and want to learn how we work with management and asset teams around the world. Our work is project-based and spans the entire INR portfolio, ranging from airports to water utilities.

If you are an excellent team player who can manage projects in an ambiguous environment and is interested in learning about asset management in the exciting infrastructure and natural resources sector, then this is the opportunity for you.

Who you'll work with

You will be part of the Value Creation & Analytics team (VCA), a distinct team within the INR group that is similar to an in-house consultant. The VCA mandate is to work on value creation and value protection initiatives together with our highly-specialized asset teams as well as the management teams of our companies.
You will be helping us deliver growing, inflation-linked cash flows over a long-term investment horizon.

We manage a geographically-diverse C$25 billion global investment portfolio and have offices in Toronto, Canada and London, United Kingdom, with additional presences in Santiago, Chile and Melbourne, Australia. Our investments are primarily through direct, privately-held, controlling or co-controlling stakes, rather than through funds or passive holdings. Taking an active approach to asset management is part of our value proposition.

The INR team consists of over 45 investment professionals with a long track record of delivering exceptional returns.
Required Skills:
What you'll need

Demonstrated interest in business topics, investments and value creation
Previous experience in consulting, infrastructure or natural resource companies is a definite asset
Advanced skills in Microsoft Office (Excel, PowerPoint, Word)
Excellent analytical and quantitative skills to perform in-depth analysis
Strong written and verbal communication skills
Ability to balance multiple priorities and initiatives while remaining detail-oriented
Intellectual curiosity
Must be enrolled in 3rd / 4th year or related Master's program
You must be enrolled in a co-op program or returning back to your studies after the work term is completed
Targeted Degrees and Disciplines:

				- Theme - Accounting and Financial Auditing

				MATH - Statistics and Actuarial Science

Job Title:
NEW
									



										Intern - Valuation, Risk Analytics & Model Validation (Input)
Job Summary:
The opportunity

Are you passionate about the future of Big Data in Finance?

If yes, we are the team for you. We work with a billion numbers a day which support the effective monitoring of the risk for the fund.
Finance is a diverse team of professionals with multifaceted backgrounds (CA, CFA, MBA, MMF). On the leading edge of the investments industry, we are continually presented with new opportunities and challenges. We provide accounting and operational services, as well as middle office analysis including performance measurement and risk modelling.

As a Risk Analytics Intern, you will be exposed to the risk measurement process from data inputs to risk analysis, which facilitate the daily monitor of risk exposure of the OTPP investment book. In this role, you will gain knowledge in understanding drivers of market risk changes, investment product pricing model, improve skills in Bloomberg, SQL and VBA coding, and apply math/computer science/business knowledge in a hands-on environment.

Who you'll work with

The Risk Analytics team is a fast paced and robust team that is responsible for producing risk reports in a timely and accurate manner to facilitate investment decision making. The Risk analytics team supports the monitoring and reporting of the fund's overall market, credit and liquidity risk exposure as well as support daily production data initiatives related to all input data and metrics.

As a Risk Analytics Intern, you will work in the Toronto office reporting to a Financial Analyst/Senior Financial Analyst and within a team of 10+ professionals. You will get the chance to collaborate closely with multiple partners, including Strategy and Risk, Data Management, Model Vetting Group, Financial Operations and IT support team.
Job Responsibilities:
What you'll do

On the input side, you will play a meaningful role in ensuring the integrity and quality of data used by the enterprise risk system.
You will be responsible to validate trade completeness, new trades, and perform market data quality checks on various data sources and programs
Gain exposure to various investment products and understand different product attributes, identify potential risk reporting issue by performing trade/data checks
Propose and implement enhancement to operational processes that govern Risk Analytics input team
Required Skills:
What you'll need

Strong quantitative background in Mathematics, Statistics or Computer Science, along with an interest in Finance, Risk or Financial Engineering.
An investment/risk management concentration is an asset
3rd/ 4th year students with previous intern experience in financial industry preferred
Advanced knowledge of Excel, VBA
SQL knowledge  preferred
Interest in working in a fast paced environment preferred.
Ability to work under pressure and meet deadlines
Targeted Degrees and Disciplines:
Targeted Clusters
			

		
		
			
				- Theme - Accounting and Financial Auditing
				
			
				- Theme - Business Administration
				
			
				- Theme - Finance and Investment 
				
			
				- Theme - Insurance and Risk Management 
				
			
				ARTS/MATH - Finance
				
			
				ARTS/MATH/SCI - Chartered Professional Accounting
				
			
				MATH - Applied Mathematics
				
			
				MATH - Business
				
			
				MATH - Combinatorics and Optimization
				
			
				MATH - Computer Science
				
			
				MATH - Computing and Financial Management
				
			
				MATH - Pure Mathematics
				
			
				MATH - Statistics and Actuarial Science
Application Documents Required: University of Waterloo Co-op Work History,Cover Letter,Résumé,Grade Report

Job Summary:
With net assets of almost $22 billion, OPTrust invests and manages one of Canada's largest pension funds. OPTrust is a global investor with a team of experienced investment professionals located in Toronto, London and Sydney.
OPTrust's investment mandate focuses on achieving the organization's mission to pay pensions today and preserve pensions for tomorrow. We are a pension management organization. Our members depend on us to provide secure, predictable income in retirement. Our investment strategy is aligned with our members' interests and seeks to deliver the returns we need to keep the Plan fully funded at the lowest level of risk.

Job Description
The Investment Risk group at OPTrust provides independent oversight as a "second line of defense" to protect the organization from undue loss. We are responsible for the measuring, managing and reporting of investment risks associated with the investment of the assets of the OPSEU Pension Plan. Investment risk includes market risk, credit risk, counterparty risk and liquidity risk. A challenging and excellent learning opportunity awaits an enthusiastic co-op student for the position of Investment Risk Assistant.
Job Responsibilities:
Job General Responsibilities
 
Assist in the development of tools and processes that help to understand risks and improve investment decisions that are being taken in the total fund. Automate processes when appropriate, and potentially helping to design and develop investment risk dashboards to identify and highlight the concentration of risks in the portfolio.  
 
Collaborate with the investment division to conduct research on topics, such as 1) key risk metrics (e.g., tail risk) and their applications; 2) emerging risks in the market (e.g. economic, political, capital markets, regulatory, etc.); 3) risk modeling of multi asset class hedge funds (working directly with external investment managers is required).
 
Provide assistance in data analysis to support the production of risk reports and presentations for communication to key stakeholders (e.g. Executive Committee, Board of Trustees, Sponsors and External Partners).
Required Skills:
Qualifications
To be considered for this position, the resume must clearly demonstrate:

-  Understanding of, and experience with basic investment and risk management concepts preferred
-  Computer skills including VBA, Python, R or Matlab
-  Strong analytical and problem solving skills
-  Ability to conduct independent research using traditional and alternative resources to produce reports
-  Excellent oral and written communication skills including presentation skills

Competencies
-  Analytical and critical thinking

-  Demonstrates creativity and enthusiasm

Company Overview
			The Oracle Cloud offers complete SaaS application suites for ERP, HCM and CX, plus best-in-class database Platform as a Service (PaaS) and Infrastructure as a Service (IaaS) from data centers throughout the Americas, Europe and Asia. For more information about Oracle (NYSE:ORCL), please visit us at oracle.com. 
			 
Group Overview
			On November 7, 2016 Oracle's acquisition of NetSuite became official, bringing together the reach of NetSuite's cloud ERP solutions for small to midsize businesses with the breadth and depth of Oracle's enterprise-grade cloud solutions for the back and front office. In 1998, NetSuite pioneered the Cloud Computing revolution, establishing the world's first company dedicated to delivering business applications over the Internet. Today, NetSuite provides a suite of cloud-based financials / Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) and omnichannel commerce software that runs the business of more than 30,000 companies, organizations, and subsidiaries in more than 100 countries.
			 
Why Oracle NetSuite

Job Summary:
Original Studios Inc. is an early stage game development studio currently working on an untitled game project. The company was founded early 2020 by me, a UW CS grad (https://www.linkedin.com/in/sergei-bezborodko-031a362a/), and the company currently consists of me and an artist contractor. Since graduating in 2011 I worked in San Francisco at various small startups, follwed by 5 years at Uber, and now I've decided to take the plunge and finally build out my dream company while I still can.

I'm looking for someone that can help speed up the development process and get the game out the door faster. The game is written in C# using the Unity engine, targeting the PC platform, and it's been under full-time development since August last year. It's a top-down perspective survival game, drawing inspiration from games like Don't Starve and The Long Dark. You'll be working closely with me and the artist to build out a bunch of new features, help fix bugs and even contribute to game design ideas and planning. An interest in playing games in this survival genre would be ideal.

Officially I have a spot at a coworking space here in downtown Toronto, but of course haven't been going since the recent lockdowns. If things look a lot better with regards to covid by the time the work term starts in May, being able to work in person would be ideal.

Check out a blog post I wrote a while back for more about the company and early progtooress shots:
https://originalstudiosinc.com/2020/05/the-journey-so-far/
Job Responsibilities:
- Translate requirements into complicated but clean and efficient code
- Produce prototypes of gameplay ideas and features
- Develop schedules and determine milestones
- Create unit tests and validation procedures to assure quality
- Detect identification and resolution and document technical specifications
- Polish the game, maintain code, fix bugs and iron out occurring problems
Required Skills:
- Proficiency in C# or similar languages like Java
- Experience with Unity very ideal
- Experience working closely with a team, including collaboration, estimation and sprint planning
- Being able to work productively and reliably on your own
- An interest in gaming, especially in survival genre based games, would be great

Job Summary:
About Us
We're a fintech leader in the institutional debt capital markets - the largest capital market sector in the world - that is laser focused on transforming how global investment banks, institutional investors, corporations and governments connect. Overbond is working on developing disruptive AI technology that will bring the latest advances in data science and machine learning to the primary bond market. Our team is composed of individuals with deep expertise, from both a technical and industry perspective, that are truly motivated by the opportunity and the space. We value sharp minds, integrity, high performance, collaboration, and purpose. Our mindset is to innovate and challenge convention. At Overbond, we believe that change is the only constant and that problems are opportunities in disguise.

The Opportunity
Overbond's Spring Analyst will be responsible for producing and maintaining industry-leading research reports designed for sophisticated market participants in global bond markets. The Research Analyst will work as part of a growing team reporting to Head of Product. The position will entail creating engaging content, applying advanced analytics, customized for Overbond's distinct stakeholders including bond issuers, investment banks and securities regulators.

Successful candidate(s) will have a truly exciting opportunity to be part of the industry-leading fintech company changing the way how global investment banks, institutional investors, corporations and governments access the capital markets. The candidate will work with top-notch industry professionals and will be given ample amount of opportunities to learn and contribute.

Collect research requirements and author industry-leading content for Overbond's client base.

Enhance Overbond's culture of thought leadership and innovation.

Interest or experience in institutional capital markets industry.
Passion for problem-solving, capital markets and technology.
Thirst to educate customer base on fintech solutions.
Highly detailed-oriented and self-motivated.
Demonstrated ability to work in a fast-paced, dynamic and deadline-oriented environment.

Job Summary:
Owens Corning is a Company with an unwavering commitment to delivering solutions, transforming markets and enhancing lives. It's who we are. It's why we are here. We do it by fully engaging our employees in support of growing our customer's businesses. And when we do, we grow ours as well.

When people think of Owens Corning, they often picture the Pink Panther, who appears predominantly in its advertising campaigns. Best known for its PINK FIBERGLAS home insulation and other products that conserve energy, which helps protect the environment, Owens Corning is a world leader in building materials systems and composite solutions. Owens Corning's people redefine what's possible each day to deliver high-quality products and services ranging from insulation, roofing, siding and manufactured stone to glass composite materials used in high-performance applications.  

A Fortune 500 company for more than 50 years, Owens Corning has cultivated a culture that emphasizes safety, performance and accountability, openness and stewardship. Owens Corning's emphasis on its people and its commitment to its corporate values  Integrity, Respect, Accountability, Fun, Sharing, Candor and Innovation  result in a unique employment experience

Job Summary:
Paralucent is a fun IT solutions company and we have been around for over 17+ years with impressive projects ranging from financial industry, telco and education. We are located close to Union Station in Toronto however this position will be remote. Most importantly it is a great work environment.

Who Are We Looking For?
You may not have all the experience and we don't expect you to but you are smart and have a passion to learn new technology. You thrive on technical challenges because the projects we work on cover many technologies such as MVC Framework SharePoint, SQL, etc. You pay attention to detail and are committed to follow tasks to completion. You work well independently and in a team environment.

How Do We Work?
We are versatile with most of our code written in PHP, C# and JavaScript, we use tools such as Drupal and Visual Studio. We work in small teams and our office is open concept because we believe that collaboration is a key factor to success. We adapt our methodologies to what we see fit best for our client and the project. We value the opinions of each team member, as an individual you have an impact on how we do things. We make time for fun.
Job Responsibilities:
A Day In The Life of A Web Application Engineer

Start your day between 08:00 AM-10:00 AM by catching up on everyone's story and reading emails with a coffee or tea. Get together with project lead or scrum master for a meeting to review the accomplishments and set goals for today. When you settled down you start working on the tasks.

At lunch time you may want to try out one of the many restaurants that you find nearby our office or you bring your own and eat with other team members in our lunch room. In the afternoon a manager may ask you to look at a production issue which needs immediate attention.

We value candidates that have a passion for what they do and are motivated to learn new skills. If you love creating web applications in a productive yet relaxed environment, we would welcome you to join Paralucent.
Required Skills:
Desired skills:

Scripting: JQuery or Angular.JS

Strong understanding or desire to learn web based technologies.

Job Summary:
Highlights
We are looking to recruit four talented students for our Pricing and Valuation teams.  The internships provide an opportunity to obtain valuable hands-on industry experience from experts in the field while participating and contributing to the teams' work and vision.  The roles are as follow:

1 Canadian Pricing
1 Canadian Valuation
2 US Pricing and Valuation - This term we offer our applicants an unique and exciting prospect - the opportunity to work in a hybrid Pricing-Valuation role.  This role will encompass working in the two US teams simultaneously.  We have two openings for this role in the US teams.

The internships will be situated in our Canadian office, which is conveniently located in downtown Toronto near Union Station, accessible by GO Transit and the TTC.  Note that the posted positions are for a 4 month work term, with the flexibility of extending to 8 months.  Depending on the state of the pandemic, the interns may be required to work remotely.

About the organization - PartnerRe is a leading global Life and P&C reinsurer, providing multi-line risk management solutions to clients around the world.  You will be working in PartnerRe's North America Life Reinsurance Division, which is a rapidly expanding business unit of PartnerRe Ltd.

AXIS Modelling - Design and build projection models for individual life reinsurance transactions.
Data Analysis - Work extensively with large datasets in SQL and R to perform rigorous analysis of client experience data.
Financial Analysis - Assist in the preparation and analysis of reserves, required capital, and financial statements.
Project Work - Provide on-demand support to Valuation and Pricing functions (experience analysis, inforce management, etc).

We encourage innovations and process improvements from our staff.  If you are someone who would like to leave an impact and make a difference, please apply!

Job Summary:
About PartnerStack
PartnerStack helps companies acquire more customers and drive new revenue with partnerships. That's why fast-growing SaaS companies like Asana, Freshworks and Intuit use the PartnerStack platform to power their reseller, marketing and referral programs.
We pride ourselves on building products people really want to use. Every member of the PartnerStack team is passionate about developing their skills, delivering value to customers and bringing a unique perspective to our company. We love to work with curious people who are excited to grow, and help others grow alongside them. Is that you?

About you and the role
Our product managers come from unique backgrounds, but what we share is the ability to apply product fundamentals and stakeholder management skills to customer-facing and internal features. You have broad knowledge and an ability to quickly learn and understand the nuances of various business and partner relationships. You're passionate about being a key source of mentorship and growth for your peers. You learn from your product launch stories, successful or otherwise and want to handle solutions and features from concept to fruition.
Job Responsibilities:
- Support the roadmap for the Partner and Marketplace experience
- Evaluate and prioritize new opportunities, manage backlog grooming and sprint planning for full-stack software engineers (Python / Vue) and product designers. You will be working extensively in Confluence and Jira
- Develop clear and detailed product requirements/ user stories
- Work closely with internal engineers, product designers to execute on the building and iterating on new and existing features of the application
- Monitor product adoption, proactively identifying opportunities and making actionable recommendations to drive product uptake and effectiveness
- Manage and communicate project schedules, goals, and dependencies, and drive cross-functional initiatives
Required Skills:
- Experience or interest in Product Management
- The ability to read code (Python / JavaScript) would be a huge asset
- Experience or understanding of working iteratively (Agile) directly with an Engineering and Design team and examples where you've successfully adjusted and iterated around constraints
- Understanding of SDLC, software architecture, and modern product methodologies (Lean, HCD, etc.) honed through dozens of product releases
- Experience leading teams and delivering to KPIs
- An aptitude for client management and a special touch for getting buy-in. All of our product managers are client-facing and will work with a wide range of stakeholders
Targeted Degrees and Disciplines:
Targeted Clusters
			

		
		
			
				- Theme - Computing: Information Systems 
				
			
				- Theme - Computing: Software
				
			
				ENG - Mechanical and Mechatronics Engineering
				
			
				ENG - Systems Design and Biomedical Engineering

Job Summary:
Changing the world, one city at a time!
 
Are you looking to make a lasting impact in the world and embrace the collective power of micromobility? Join the leading bike sharing company!
 
PBSC is present in over 35 cities. From Barcelona to Rio de Janeiro, we provide turn key solutions to cities looking for bike sharing systems. 
 
As a One Team, we are driven by passion, performance also imagination.
 
PBSC develops full stack products including mechanical, electrical and software engineering components. Our solutions range from electric bikes and grid-connected charging stations to solar powered wireless terminals.
 
Whether you want to tackle circuit design, power electronics, embedded firmware development, Java development on Amazon infrastructure, Elastic Search, Node.js, Android, iOS or web applications, IoT systems, automation deployment technologies and more, PBSC has a spot for you in a rich learning environment.
Job Responsibilities:
We are looking for passionate, self driven interns who like to push the bounds of what is possible to participate in our product development process!
 
As a function of their interests and competencies, interns will develop solutions ranging from Java/Hibernate/Spring server components, ReactNative iOS or Android applications, embedded C firmware development, Bluetooth stacks, Node.js microservices, Angular.js web applications or big data optimization with Elastic Search. We have a lot of full stack development projects and you will get to experience many different technologies in a distributed, worldwide 24/7 operation environment. Come join us and see what it means to work for a world leader in green technologies!
 
Development occurs under Windows or Linux (your choice), using Git, IntelliJ and other tools depending on the task at hand. We use GitFlow, JIRA, Confluence, Slack and a whole bunch of other productivity tools.
Required Skills:
Experience with circuit design, power electronics or mechatronics.
Experience with Windows, Linux and Altium.
Team worker with an efficient and organized work ethic.
Curious and passionate about new technologies.
Autonomous, rigorous and driven by quality.
Bilingual, as an asset.

 *We are eager to learn more about you! Tell us in few words why or how you fit with our values:  passion, performance and imagination.
Targeted Degrees and Disciplines:
Targeted Clusters
			

		
		
			
				ENG - Electrical and Computer Engineering
Application Documents Required: University of Waterloo Co-op Work History,Résumé,Grade Report

Job Summary:
The future you want is within reach.
 
At PCL, we build the places where life happens and find camaraderie in the process. We're a community of builders committed to building better communities. That's why we're always looking ahead, and not just to the next project or what's next in our industry.
 
We're also looking at what's next for you and how we can help you build a career you're proud of. Take your education to the next level and contribute to projects that make a difference in your community. PCL is a place where you are a crucial part of the team from your first day on the job.
 
We are currently seeking Engineering and Estimating students within our Calgary District to work on some of the most exciting projects currently underway. Please note that at the time of application, students will be considered for both the engineering and estimating roles; Project assignments are determined prior to the start date of hire. We are looking for students available for 4, 8, 12 or 16 months.
Job Responsibilities:
As an Engineering or Estimating Student, you will contribute to our team by being involved in a combination of the following duties dependent on the assigned project:
 
Project Coordination

Coordinate drawings
Coordinate work specific scope / trades
Conduct trade quote reviews - verify material quantities, verify hours, verify rates
Participate in project meetings
Conduct deficiency walks
Input / Update deficiency logs
Issue warranties
Take / Coordinate progress photos
Update field drawings
Produce as-built drawings

Field Coordination

Perform quantity takeoffs
Coordinate sub-trade work
Verify site conditions and coordinate with drawings
Supervise sub-trade work
Set-up / Maintain record keeping
Layout site lines and grades using total station

Scheduling:

Update project schedules
Create manual schedules
Create and update schedules using Suretrak software
Obtain scheduling information from sub-trades
Create and maintain graphical scheduling using AutoCAD.
Monitor Manpower productivity

Estimating 

Performing quantity survey assignments and review them with the Senior Estimator or Chief Estimator;
Providing quantities of major purchase items to purchasing department for pricing;
Transferring quantities to Senior Estimator;
Performing general subtrade solicitation duties;
Performing bid document control;
Performing bid day assignments;
Assisting in closing a bid;
Visiting job sites periodically;
Developing relationships with subcontractors; and
Other duties as assigned by the Chief Estimator.
Required Skills:
What you will bring to the role:

Candidates must have a strong desire to work in a construction environment and prior field construction experience will be considered an asset.
Application of various computer software programs will be required, including word processing, spreadsheet applications and drafting. 

PCL is an innovative, employee-owned company comprised of people who find passion in their profession and take pride in doing great work every day. Our work powers the infrastructure and utilities that are essential to daily life and our projects are the scene of vacations, careers, education and healing. We are consistently ranked among the best companies to work for because we are committed to supporting and developing our teams.
 
The PCL Companies celebrate diversity and are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to an inclusive environment for all employees and applicants and will make all employment-related decisions without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, disability or veteran status.
 
Should you require an accommodation during the application process, please contact us at careers@pcl.com with the position and location you are interested in.

Together, we can build success and a better future. Let's get started!

At PCL, you are more than just a student. You could be part of a team that works hard, plays hard, and makes a difference in your community. Choosing a co-op at PCL will provide you with challenging assignments and a supportive work environment which promotes personal and professional growth.

Job Summary:
My Career. My Company. My Legacy.
 
At PCL, you are more than just a student. You could be part of a team that works hard, plays hard, and makes a difference in your community. Choosing a co-op at PCL will provide you with challenging assignments and a supportive work environment which promotes personal and professional growth.
 
Whether you are looking for a corporate or construction career, exciting opportunities are waiting for you. Our people have helped us stand out as a leading general contracting organization, which is why we're always looking for new talent - individuals who can bring innovative solutions and thinking to every project. Construction is a complicated business and our success requires the skills and efforts of a diverse group of people, engaged in a wide variety of activities. Our 100-plus-year tradition of construction excellence is attributable in large part to the efforts of men and women of different cultures, backgrounds, and beliefs. PCL values the additional perspectives, solutions, and ideas that come from a diverse workforce. We recognize that these factors allow us to better achieve company objectives and meet the needs of our customers.
 
We are currently seeking a Business Development Student for our Canadian Buildings Division - Toronto District in Oakville, Ontario to work on exciting strategic initiatives currently underway. We are looking for students available for a minimum of 4 months starting in May 2021.
Job Responsibilities:
The role will involve a combination of the following duties:

Support business development and new markets strategic development through research and data mining
Learn various data analytic tools such as Sales Force
Prepare custom reports and presentations to meet the organization's needs
Provide analytical support regarding interpretation, analysis and presentation of data
Maintains confidentiality of client and corporate information
Where gaps in data quality exist, perform data cleansing, data filling, and benchmarking against independent data sources
Participate in, or lead, ad hoc initiatives
Required Skills:
Skills Required:

Superior trend spotting and analytical skills
High attention to detail and the ability to multi-task
Highly organized self-starter
Excellent computer, word processing, desktop publishing, and researching skills
Ability to maintain confidentiality
Ability to develop and sustain positive working relationships with internal and external stakeholders
Understanding of data analytics and how to integrate it into the business process
Understanding of emerging digitization trends
Efficient, enthusiastic and flexible
Targeted Degrees and Disciplines:
Targeted Clusters
			

		
		
			
				- Theme - Business Administration
				
			
				- Theme - Marketing and Communication 
				
			
				- Theme - Sales and Business Development 
				
			
				ARTS - Business
				
			
				MATH - Business
Application Documents Required: University of Waterloo Co-op Work History,Cover Letter,Résumé,Grade Report

Strong writer with excellent spelling, grammar, and proofreading skills
Proven skills in project management and consulting with internal and external clients/stakeholders

About Us

Pencil is a stealth edtech startup on a mission to revolutionize the way teachers teach. We're building software that enables teachers to maximize their student reach, cut down on busy work, and improve student outcomes with cutting-edge ML that delivers personalized learning experiences.


About Our Founders

Our founders are experienced leaders in Silicon Valley and have already led Pencil to successfully acquire paying customers in the U.S. and abroad.

Ayush Agarwal, CEO
Ayush is a seasoned product leader having served as Head of Product at both Google and Facebook. He also has experience in venture capital and continues to invest in early-stage startups. Ayush graduated with a Bachelor's in Computer Science from the University of Michigan and is passionate about education and mentoring future leaders in tech.

Amogh Asgekar, CTO
Amogh has over 10 years of experience building large-scale content recommendations and machine learning systems from scratch at Google, in a vast variety of products serving over 1 billion users ranging from News, Google+, Ads, Google Now and Play. His focus has been on pushing the envelope forÂ building descriptive user profiles and complex deep learning models for understanding users and maximizing their experience on each product. Amogh has won multiple innovation awards for the above and holds a Master's Degree from the Indian Institute of Technology (IIT) with a specialization in machine learning and data mining.

Job Summary: Pepperdata's team has been working with Big Data long before it was Big Data. At companies like Yahoo, Google, Microsoft, and Netflix, we've seen the huge impact that comes from quickly and reliably making use of massive amounts of data. We solve really hard problems, and we move fast, but we engineer things the right way.  We are customer focused with some of the world's leading companies running their businesses on our software.
Job Responsibilities:
Help build performance managements solutions to dynamically tune  customer clusters and collect metrics.  Integrate with different distributed streaming and execution engines (i.e. Kafka, Spark, Tez, Impala, MapReduce, etc.) to collect telemetry data.  Use the collected metrics and telemetry data to provide automated insights and recommendations to customers/developers.

Work closely with a focused development team to quickly iterate on new solutions.
Required Skills:
Experience developing in Java required.
Experience with Linux commands and scripting languages a plus.
Strong communication and collaboration skills required.
Demonstrated ability to come up to speed on new software stacks required.
Experience with large-scale distributed systems including Hadoop, Spark and Kafka a plus.

Job Summary:
At PepsiCo Canada, we have great brands, great distribution systems and great quality products, all of which are led by great people! To ensure we stay on the path of delivering great results, it is important that we continue to develop a deep bench of talented leaders. Our ability to grow year after year is driven by our ability to attract, develop, and retain world class people who will thrive in the PepsiCo environment.

Our people are our greatest asset. By supporting their ability to work effectively together and providing them with the tools they need to succeed, we are ensuring that PepsiCo Canada is the kind of company where talented people of all backgrounds want to work. The PepsiCo Canada co-op program will provide candidates with a unique opportunity to build their experience and leadership skills.
Job Responsibilities:
Position Summary
During your 4-month (possible extension to 8-month) co-op term starting in May 2021, you'll be fully immersed in our operations, learning the business from two unique perspectives:

Ground Up
During your first project, you will learn what it takes to develop and sustain a growing CPG business and stretch your current skills by delivering, selling and marketing our products to a set group of retailers. You will be responsible for managing our business with these customers from start to finish, including:
Delivering consistent sales targets
Understanding, planning and executing advertising displays in conjunction with customers
Performing inventory and cash management on a weekly basis
Merchandising product for customers
Building Critical Business Skills
As you progress through your term, you will have the opportunity to apply the knowledge you attained on the front-lines. Our Sales interns will work closely with our Zone Leadership Team and will be responsible for utilizing strong analytical and communication skills to help the team deliver results with our most important customers. Key aspects of this assignment include:
Frontline leadership training
Sales forecasting
Daily and weekly Area Sales reporting
Assist Zone Leadership with sales projects
Market execution projects
Other unique projects
Qualifications
Completion of second or third year of a Business Degree
High academic achievement along with demonstrated ability to pursue other interests at the same time
A skilled problem solver who enjoys challenges
Strong oral and written communication skills and the ability to confidently interact with all levels within the organization, from front-line to executive
Valid, full driver's license, with a flawless driving record
Reliable and consistent access to a personal vehicle
A self-starter with the ability to plan work to meet objectives, set priorities and manage work schedule
Required Skills:
Qualifications
Completion of second or third year of a Business Degree
High academic achievement along with demonstrated ability to pursue other interests at the same time
A skilled problem solver who enjoys challenges
Strong oral and written communication skills and the ability to confidently interact with all levels within the organization, from front-line to executive
Valid, full driver's license, with a flawless driving record
Reliable and consistent access to a personal vehicle
A self-starter with the ability to plan work to meet objectives, set priorities and manage work schedule

Targeted Clusters
			

		
		
			
				- Theme - Business Administration
				
			
				- Theme - Data Analytics, Statistical Analysis and Mathematical Optimization 
				
			
				- Theme - Sales and Business Development 
				
			
				ARTS - Business

				ARTS - Social Sciences
				
			
				ARTS/MATH - Finance
				
			
				ARTS/MATH/SCI - Chartered Professional Accounting

				SCI - Business

Success in this role will require results-driven behavior, intellectual curiosity, analytical thinking, technical prowess, and the ability to bring others with you.

Responsibilities
Identify and assist in implementing processes that improve effectiveness and eliminate redundancies
Build analytical literacy capability with the Key Account / Sales
Support sales and multi-functional teams on customer-facing initiatives
Analyze complex sets of data and clearly share relevant insights
Financial reconciliation
Required Skills:
Qualifications
Completion of second or third year of a Business Degree
High academic achievement along with demonstrated ability to pursue other interests at the same time
Strong communication / interpersonal skills and the ability to communicate effectively
Excellent Microsoft Excel skills
Analytical and conceptual thinking skills
Demonstrated ability to thrive in fast paced, complex environment
Ability to work independently with minimal supervision
Reliable and consistent access to a personal vehicle

				- Theme - Business Administration

Job Summary:
At PepsiCo Canada, we have great brands, great distribution systems and great quality products, all of which are led by great people! To ensure we stay on the path of delivering great results, it is important that we continue to develop a deep bench of talented leaders. Our ability to grow year after year is driven by our ability to attract, develop, and retain world class people who will thrive in the PepsiCo environment. 
 
Our people are our greatest asset. By supporting their ability to work effectively together and providing them with the tools they need to succeed, we are ensuring that PepsiCo Canada is the kind of company where talented people of all backgrounds want to work. The PepsiCo Canada co-op program will provide candidates with a unique opportunity to build their experience and leadership skills.
Job Responsibilities:
Position Summary 
If you're hungry for a challenge and have a taste for working with people, then we would like to meet you!  We're looking for an energetic, enterprising and independent individual to join the Ontario team as an HR Co-op in Brampton. As part of your co-op, you will be a part of the HR Team in delivering HR service, leadership and support to the sales business. The position will begin in May of 2021 with a term length of 4 months.  
 
As part of your co-op term, your job responsibilities will include:  
Leading frontline recruitment, including sourcing, resume screening, interviewing, testing and candidate selection.
Coordinate and support the campus recruitment process, including organizing campus events and recruiting sessions. 
Supporting the execution of the employee engagement in areas such as retention, compensation, diversity and inclusion and communication.  
Assist the HR Director and HR Managers with the implementation of HR programs or initiatives. 
Participate in HR and Change Management projects.  
 
Note that regular travel will be required for campus events, career fairs, information sessions, etc.
Required Skills:
Qualifications / Requirements
Qualifications 
As the successful candidate, you would already be: 
Completing a post-secondary or graduate program, preferably with a Human Resources, Industrial Relations/Employee Relations focus 
Exceptional with your interpersonal and communication skills, both oral and written 
Analytical with a strong attention to detail 
Adaptable with a quick learning capability 
Have experience with Microsoft Office suite (Word/Excel/PowerPoint/Outlook) 
Able to set priorities, take initiative and work with little direction 
Reliable and consistent access to a personal vehicle
Targeted Degrees and Disciplines:
Targeted Clusters
			

		
		
			
				- Theme - Business Administration
				
			
				- Theme - Human Factors and Ergonomics
				
			
				- Theme - Human Resources
				
			
				ARTS - Business

				MATH - Applied Mathematics
				
			
				MATH - Business

				MATH - Computer Science
				
			
				MATH - Computing and Financial Management
				
			
				MATH - Pure Mathematics
				
			
				MATH - Statistics and Actuarial Science
				
			
				MATH - Teaching

Job Summary:
Hey College/University students! Are you hungry for an exciting and challenging opportunity in a fast-paced, diverse organization? If so, you have a future at PepsiCo. As a world class organization, we strive for excellence in everything that we do, from a new product launch to delivering a product to a store.

To accomplish our goals, we need talented, innovative people who know how to work hard and have fun! We need people who want to make a difference. Taste the success with Canada's fastest growing consumer packaged goods company and discover how our passion for growth creates big challenges - and big opportunities - personally, professionally, and financially.
Job Responsibilities:
Position Summary
You will develop and sustain a growing snack foods business and leverage your skills by selling and delivering our products to your assigned group of retail customers at grocery stores, gas stations, and convenience stores. Your responsibilities will include:

Selling and Developing the Business

Identifying changing customer needs through a constant review of the highest selling products and frequent communication with store managers.
Developing all assigned accounts relative to sales volume, market share, product distribution, space allocation and customer service objectives.
Selling and executing national and local promotions, incremental sales, displays, racks and selling sufficient product inventory for customer volume demands.

Building Critical Business Skills

Managing inventory according to PepsiCo Foods Canada best practices to ensure balanced accounts and fresh products for customers and consumers.
Executing hands on activities with excellence, including but not limited to managing product placement on shelves, increasing shelf facings and racks, handling carton returns, managing inventory movement and cleaning shelving and racks.
Operating a route sales truck including loading and unloading of product OR operating a personal vehicle along an established route.


Does this sound interesting? Check out this video to learn more about our Route Sales Representative role: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qW172pgV88o&t=9s
Required Skills:
Qualifications

Preference of College/University students with first year completed
Physically active/strong - able to lift approx. 50 pounds and be on your feet all day
Able to work early mornings and weekends
Great with people and excellent communication skills
Outstanding organizational skills, demonstrated by your ability to handle multiple priorities, problem solve, and meet deadlines or targets
Motivated and enthusiastic - spirited individual who can keep their energy up all day long
Sales experience with a consumer packaged goods or retail organization preferred


If sales is your strength, and you are eager to learn a world-class business and represent some of Canada's most loved brands like Lay's, Doritos and Tostitos, then this might be the career for you!
Targeted Degrees and Disciplines:
Targeted Clusters
			

		
		
			
				- Theme - Business Administration
				
			
				- Theme - Marketing and Communication 
				
			
				- Theme - Sales and Business Development 
				
			
				ARTS - Business
				
			
				ARTS - Social Sciences
				
			
				ARTS/MATH - Finance
				
			
				ENV - Business, Enterprise and Development
				
			
				MATH - Applied Mathematics
				
			
				MATH - Business
				
			
				MATH - Combinatorics and Optimization
				
			
				MATH - Pure Mathematics
				
			
				MATH - Statistics and Actuarial Science
				
			
				SCI - Business
Application Documents Required: University of Waterloo Co-op Work History,Résumé,Grade Report

Job Summary:
POSITION: Finance Intern (4 month Summer Term - May - August)
LOCATION: Mississauga, ON 

At PepsiCo Canada, we have great brands, great distribution systems and great quality products, all of which are led by great people!  To ensure we stay on the path of delivering great results, it is important that we continue to develop a deep bench of talented leaders.  Our ability to grow year after year is driven by our ability to attract, develop, and retain world class people who will thrive in the PepsiCo environment. 

Our people are our greatest asset.  By supporting their ability to work effectively together and providing them with the tools they need to succeed, we are ensuring that PepsiCo Canada is the kind of company where talented people of all backgrounds want to work.  The PepsiCo Canada co-op program will provide candidates with a unique opportunity to build their experience and leadership skills.
Job Responsibilities:
What Will You Do In This Role?

Reporting to a Business Unit Finance Manager, the Financial Intern will help lead their business team by ensuring pricing, trade spending, supply chain management, marketing spending, new product initiative launches, and large retail and marketing promotions to optimize the company's revenue and profit objectives.

This is accomplished with a detailed understanding of the businesses revenue and profits drivers, a bias toward action and active collaboration with the business team. Activities will include: analyzing financial performance; identifying issues, risks and opportunities; developing finance initiatives for your business unit; support business forecasting and strategic planning.
Required Skills:
What Are We Looking For?

Enrolled in a graduate/undergraduate Business program with a Finance focus.
Will preferably be looking to pursue a finance designation
A problem solver who can lead a multi-functional business team of marketing, sales and supply chain professionals
Keen business instincts
Outstanding organizational skills, with the ability to manage multiple projects and meet deadlines
Must be results oriented with a positive "can-do" attitude
Strong quantitative and analytical problem solving skills
Superior interpersonal and communication skills
Ability to work well in a team environment
Targeted Degrees and Disciplines:

Job Summary:
POSITION:  Finance Analytics Internship (4 month Summer Term - May - August)
LOCATION: Mississauga, ON 

Are you hungry for an exciting and challenging opportunity in a fast-paced, diverse organization?
 
If so, you have a future at PepsiCo. As a world class organization, we strive for excellence in everything that we do!  To accomplish our goals, we need talented, innovative, creative people who know how to work hard and have fun.

 
Taste the success with Canada's fastest growing CPG Company, and discover how our passion for growth creates big challenges and big opportunities: personally, professionally, and financially.
 
At PepsiCo, we leverage an amazing range of technologies throughout our business; from mobile apps to advanced analytics, from cloud connected sensors to complex data integrations and everything in between.
 
Reasons to Consider PepsiCo for your Co-op Placement:

Ongoing professional development to expand your business knowledge
Opportunities to work with a wide range of functional departments and leaders
Make an impactful change with your projects
Ability to flex work arrangements
To work with, and learn from business partners to gain key decision making skills
Take part in monthly department and company social events, such as social meet-ups, volunteer events, and PEP talks!

 
Previous Co-op Student's Experiences:
We've had co-op students of all different levels; Junior, Intermediate, and Senior, all have great, impactful terms! They were given the opportunity to work with various functions such as Customer Development, Sales, HR and Supply Chain; gaining business knowledge to provide key insights.
 
Our students have made large impacts in providing visibility to the company, and driving key decisions to be made through the use of Tableau dashboarding. Whether it is Sales Forecast Accuracy, Sales Fundamentals, or year-end reporting, our co-op students are given the opportunity to make an impact and leave an impression on upper management with their data analytic skills.
 
Responsibilities

Engage technology and business leaders to leverage business tools to solve real world business challenges
Leverage PepsiCo's advanced technology stack to deliver key insights to drive cost savings and opportunity growth
Learn various data analytic tools such as Tableau, Trifacta, Azure, and Hadoop
Consult with Business Partners to provide key data insights
Work in a team environment supporting day to day tasks along with Analytics Team
Act as the point of contact and communicate project status to all stakeholders
Support project plan development, monitoring and tracking project schedule
Become a dependable technology leader in the analytics space
Job Responsibilities:
Requirements

Motivated learner enrolled in a Business, Computers, Engineering, or IT related program
Experience in Advanced Analytics from conception to delivery preferred
Motivated learner with the eagerness to enter the Business Analytics fields
Previous work experience as a Business Analyst or similar role preferred
Exposure to Waterfall and Agile Methodologies
Solid communication, organizational skills, including multitasking and time-management required
Strong skills in developing presentations and reports
Strong working knowledge of SQL and Data Competency skills required
Working experience with Dashboarding (e.g. Tableau, Business Objects, Power BI) and Data wrangling tools (e.g. Trifacta, VBA Macros) preferred.
Experience working with advanced analytical programming such as R, Python, etc. preferred.
Fun, social, outgoing!
Required Skills:
Job Requirements

Working towards a University degree in Business and/or MBA
Strong communication / interpersonal skills and the ability to communicate effectively 
Excellent Microsoft Excel skills
Analytical and conceptual thinking skills 
Demonstrated ability to thrive in fast paced, complex environment 
Ability to work independently with minimal supervision
Targeted Degrees and Disciplines:
Targeted Clusters

				SCI - Business

LOCATION: Mississauga, ON 

Are you hungry for an exciting and challenging opportunity in a fast-paced, diverse organization?

If so, you have a future at PepsiCo. As a world class organization, we strive for excellence in everything that we do!  To accomplish our goals, we need talented, innovative, creative people who know how to work hard and have fun.

Job Responsibilities:
As a Robotic Process Automation (RPA) Developer, you will work with PepsiCo's Intelligent Automation Centre of Excellence and will be responsible for gathering requirements, developing code that follows frameworks and standards, testing, and deploying Process Automation Bots across various multiple PepsiCo functions.

Responsibilities

Liaise with Business clients to identify and define requirements, scope and objectives.
Develop and configure automation process as per defined requirements.
Adhere to PepsiCo's Intelligent Automation Centre of Excellence's Development Framework and Governance.
Ensure quality of coded components by performing thorough unit testing.
Work collaboratively with test teams during System Test, End-to-End and User Acceptance Test phases to fix assigned bugs with quality.
Report status, issues and risks to tech leads and project management leads on a regular basis.
Ensure documentation is well maintained
Become a dependable technology leader in the Robotics space

Experience with one or more RPA technologies (optional)
Experience with Process Analysis, Design, and Implementation, Business and Technical requirements, Problem-Solving, and System(s) Testing, including UAT and Bug fixes
.NET experience is an asset
Experience as a software tester
Solid communication, organizational skills, including multitasking and time-management required
Fun, social, outgoing!

Job Summary:
Territory Sales Representative - Summer Coop - Toronto Center 
4 Month Work Term - May-August
 
The Role:
As a Territory Sales Representative Coop, you are the first-line contact with customers and are responsible for driving and delivering large format sales volume of Quaker brands through compliance of specific customer agreements, execution of monthly priorities as well as permanent and temporary in-store development.
 
The Company
PepsiCo Canada is recognized as one of Canada's top 100 employers. PepsiCo products are enjoyed by consumers more than one billion times a day in more than 200 countries and territories around the world. Our product portfolio includes 22 world-famous, billion-dollar brands; from Gatorade to Quaker, Tropicana to Lay's and more. We make hundreds of enjoyable foods and beverages that are loved throughout the world. PepsiCo's effort to help build a more sustainable food system represents a key element of the company's broader vision of accelerated, sustainable growth known as Winning with Purpose. As part of this vision, PepsiCo is striving to be a better company by further integrating purpose into the core of its business and brands and doing even more for people and the planet.  Our purpose efforts include fostering a diverse and inclusive work environment, supporting the communities where we live and work, and improving choices in our portfolio through reformulations and new products.
 
At PepsiCo Canada, we are focused on delighting our consumers by delivering high-quality products and exciting brand campaigns.  Our people are critical to our success and by supporting their personal growth and development and providing them with the tools they need to succeed, PepsiCo Canada is a company you'll be proud to join!

What you can expect from us:

A flexible working environment that promotes a healthy work-life balance
A dynamic and inclusive culture that promotes you to bring your whole-self to work
A supportive team that will encourage your professional growth and development
An opportunity to be meaningful and impactful within your work and projects
An opportunity to give back to the community with our Always on Volunteer 360 Program
An organization that aims to use their scale, reach and expertise to build a more sustainable world
Job Responsibilities:
What you'll be working on:

Delivering large format sales volume in assigned territory through compliance of specific customer agreements, execution of monthly priorities as well as permanent and temporary in-store displays.
Perform match contact initiatives with key store level and regional level customers to enable improved field sales team execution results
Balance internal-facing needs (e.g. reporting, spending controls, meetings) and external facing needs (e.g. customer demands)
Required Skills:
Who's a good fit for the team:

Experience in varied disciplines of sales, sales management, go-to-market models or business/commerce
Pursuing a post-secondary education in business or related field
Great interpersonal and communication skills
Ability to understand and leverage strategic insight to drive results
Is collaborative and works well in a team environment
Excellent organizational and time management skills
Sound understanding of the marketplace environment of designated territory
Targeted Degrees and Disciplines:
Targeted Clusters
			

		
		
			
				- Theme - Accounting and Financial Auditing
				
			
				- Theme - Business Administration
				
			
				- Theme - Data Analytics, Statistical Analysis and Mathematical Optimization 
				
			
				- Theme - Project and Process Management
				
			
				- Theme - Sales and Business Development 
				
			
				ARTS - Business
				
			
				ENG - Management Sciences
				
			
				ENV - Business, Enterprise and Development
				
			
				MATH - Applied Mathematics
				
			
				MATH - Business
				
			
				SCI - Business
Application Documents Required: Cover Letter,Résumé,Grade Report

Job Summary:
Hey College/University students! Are you hungry for an exciting and challenging opportunity in a fast-paced, diverse organization? If so, you have a future at PepsiCo. As a world class organization, we strive for excellence in everything that we do, from a new product launch to delivering a product to a store.

To accomplish our goals, we need talented, innovative people who know how to work hard and have fun! We need people who want to make a difference. Taste the success with Canada's fastest growing consumer packaged goods company and discover how our passion for growth creates big challenges - and big opportunities - personally, professionally, and financially.
Job Responsibilities:
Position Summary
You will develop and sustain a growing snack foods business and leverage your skills by selling and delivering our products to your assigned group of retail customers at grocery stores, gas stations, and convenience stores. Your responsibilities will include:

Selling and Developing the Business

Identifying changing customer needs through a constant review of the highest selling products and frequent communication with store managers.
Developing all assigned accounts relative to sales volume, market share, product distribution, space allocation and customer service objectives.
Selling and executing national and local promotions, incremental sales, displays, racks and selling sufficient product inventory for customer volume demands.


Building Critical Business Skills

Managing inventory according to PepsiCo Foods Canada best practices to ensure balanced accounts and fresh products for customers and consumers.
Executing hands on activities with excellence, including but not limited to managing product placement on shelves, increasing shelf facings and racks, handling carton returns, managing inventory movement and cleaning shelving and racks.
Operating a route sales truck including loading and unloading of product OR operating a personal vehicle along an established route.


Does this sound interesting? Check out this video to learn more about our Route Sales Representative role: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qW172pgV88o&t=9s
Required Skills:
Qualifications

Preference of College/University Students with first year completed
Physically active/strong - able to lift approx. 50 pounds and be on your feet all day
Able to work early mornings and weekends
Great with people and excellent communication skills
Outstanding organizational skills, demonstrated by your ability to handle multiple priorities, problem solve, and meet deadlines or targets
Motivated and enthusiastic - spirited individual who can keep their energy up all day long
Sales experience with a consumer packaged goods or retail organization preferred


If sales is your strength, and you are eager to learn a world-class business and represent some of Canada's most loved brands like Lay's, Doritos and Tostitos, then this might be the career for you!
Targeted Degrees and Disciplines:
Targeted Clusters
			

		
		
			
				- Theme - Business Administration
				
			
				- Theme - Marketing and Communication 
				
			
				- Theme - Project and Process Management
				
			
				- Theme - Sales and Business Development 
				
			
				ARTS - Business
				
			
				ARTS - Social Sciences
				
			
				ARTS/MATH - Finance
				
			
				ENG - Management Sciences
				
			
				ENV - Business, Enterprise and Development
				
			
				MATH - Applied Mathematics
				
			
				MATH - Business
				
			
				MATH - Computer Science
				
			
				MATH - Pure Mathematics
				
			
				MATH - Statistics and Actuarial Science
				
			
				SCI - Business
