Hey College/University students! Are you hungry for an exciting and challenging opportunity in a fast-paced, diverse organization? If so, you have a future at PepsiCo. As a world class organization, we strive for excellence in everything that we do, from a new product launch to delivering a product to a store.

To accomplish our goals, we need talented, innovative people who know how to work hard and have fun! We need people who want to make a difference. Taste the success with Canada's fastest growing consumer packaged goods company and discover how our passion for growth creates big challenges - and big opportunities - personally, professionally, and financially.
Job Responsibilities:
Position Summary

You will develop and sustain a growing snack foods business and leverage your skills by selling and delivering our products to your assigned group of retail customers at grocery stores, gas stations, and convenience stores. Your responsibilities will include:

Selling and Developing the Business

Identifying changing customer needs through a constant review of the highest selling products and frequent communication with store managers.
Developing all assigned accounts relative to sales volume, market share, product distribution, space allocation and customer service objectives.
Selling and executing national and local promotions, incremental sales, displays, racks and selling sufficient product inventory for customer volume demands.


Building Critical Business Skills

Managing inventory according to PepsiCo Foods Canada best practices to ensure balanced accounts and fresh products for customers and consumers.
Executing hands on activities with excellence, including but not limited to managing product placement on shelves, increasing shelf facings and racks, handling carton returns, managing inventory movement and cleaning shelving and racks.
Operating a route sales truck including loading and unloading of product OR operating a personal vehicle along an established route.


Does this sound interesting? Check out this video to learn more about our Route Sales Representative role: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qW172pgV88o&t=9s
Required Skills:
Qualifications

Preference of College/University Students with first year completed
Physically active/strong - able to lift approx. 50 pounds and be on your feet all day
Able to work early mornings and weekends
Great with people and excellent communication skills
Outstanding organizational skills, demonstrated by your ability to handle multiple priorities, problem solve, and meet deadlines or targets
Motivated and enthusiastic - spirited individual who can keep their energy up all day long
Sales experience with a consumer packaged goods or retail organization preferred


If sales is your strength, and you are eager to learn a world-class business and represent some of Canada's most loved brands like Lay's, Doritos and Tostitos, then this might be the career for you!
Targeted Degrees and Disciplines:
Targeted Clusters
			

		
		
			
				- Theme - Business Administration
				
			
				- Theme - Marketing and Communication 
				
			
				- Theme - Project and Process Management
				
			
				- Theme - Sales and Business Development 
				
			
				ARTS - Business
				
			
				ARTS - Social Sciences
				
			
				ARTS/MATH - Finance
				
			
				ENG - Management Sciences
				
			
				ENV - Business, Enterprise and Development
				
			
				MATH - Applied Mathematics
				
			
				MATH - Business
				
			
				MATH - Combinatorics and Optimization
				
			
				MATH - Computer Science
				
			
				MATH - Pure Mathematics
				
			
				MATH - Statistics and Actuarial Science
				
			
				SCI - Business
Application Documents Required: University of Waterloo Co-op Work History,Résumé,Grade Report

Job Summary:
Hey College/University students! Are you hungry for an exciting and challenging opportunity in a fast-paced, diverse organization? If so, you have a future at PepsiCo. As a world class organization, we strive for excellence in everything that we do, from a new product launch to delivering a product to a store.

To accomplish our goals, we need talented, innovative people who know how to work hard and have fun! We need people who want to make a difference. Taste the success with Canada's fastest growing consumer packaged goods company and discover how our passion for growth creates big challenges - and big opportunities - personally, professionally, and financially.
Job Responsibilities:
Position Summary

You will develop and sustain a growing snack foods business and leverage your skills by selling and delivering our products to your assigned group of retail customers at grocery stores, gas stations, and convenience stores. Your responsibilities will include:

Selling and Developing the Business

Identifying changing customer needs through a constant review of the highest selling products and frequent communication with store managers.
Developing all assigned accounts relative to sales volume, market share, product distribution, space allocation and customer service objectives.
Selling and executing national and local promotions, incremental sales, displays, racks and selling sufficient product inventory for customer volume demands.


Building Critical Business Skills

Managing inventory according to PepsiCo Foods Canada best practices to ensure balanced accounts and fresh products for customers and consumers.
Executing hands on activities with excellence, including but not limited to managing product placement on shelves, increasing shelf facings and racks, handling carton returns, managing inventory movement and cleaning shelving and racks.
Operating a route sales truck including loading and unloading of product OR operating a personal vehicle along an established route.


Does this sound interesting? Check out this video to learn more about our Route Sales Representative role: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qW172pgV88o&t=9s
Required Skills:
Qualifications

Preference of College/University Students with first year completed
Physically active/strong - able to lift approx. 50 pounds and be on your feet all day
Able to work early mornings and weekends
Great with people and excellent communication skills
Outstanding organizational skills, demonstrated by your ability to handle multiple priorities, problem solve, and meet deadlines or targets
Motivated and enthusiastic - spirited individual who can keep their energy up all day long
Sales experience with a consumer packaged goods or retail organization preferred


If sales is your strength, and you are eager to learn a world-class business and represent some of Canada's most loved brands like Lay's, Doritos and Tostitos, then this might be the career for you!

Co-op Main

Job Summary:
Operations Management Co-op 


Who are we?
PepsiCo is making a difference on a global scale, and so can you!  Competing in a dynamic, fast-paced industry, our ability to grow year after year is driven by our ability to attract, develop, and retain world class people who will thrive at PepsiCo. 
 
Follow the link below to find out more about our culture and commitment to Performance with Purpose.  We believe that delivering value for our consumers and customers, protecting our environment, sourcing with integrity and investing in our employees are not simply good things to do, but that these actions fuel our returns and position PepsiCo for long-term, sustainable growth.
 
http://tinyurl.com/PepsiCoCampus
 
Operations Co-op Program
At PepsiCo Canada we're always on the lookout for great talent ? and that search often brings us to campuses like yours! So, why choose the PepsiCo Operations Co-op Program?
 

Early Responsibility: Accelerate your career progression with early responsibility and leadership
Make an Impact: Lead change in a fast paced, dynamic, and evolving industry where you can sink your teeth into challenging opportunities and drive for growth
Development and Coaching: Develop yourself and learn to develop others at a company where our People are a strategic priority
Mega Brands:  Make tangible impact on Globally Recognized Billion Dollar brands! Your friends and family can touch and taste the impact you make!
	 

At PepsiCo you will have total ownership over your success; by Delivering Results and Doing Things the Right Way your future possibilities are endless.  From our great brands, to our great culture; come for one experience, you'll stay for 10!
 
What will you do in your first experience?
You'll be based out of one of our world class manufacturing facilities in Western Canada; Lethbridge or Taber, AB. Your role will be to lead a team of 15-30 frontline employees and manage through the challenges of doing so in a Supply Chain organization, including motivating the team, problem solving issues, and removing barriers in order to help "win the shift". You will hold responsibility for the operations of the department on your shift and will set the agenda for your team in order to enable them to achieve the Business Unit expectations in the Key Performance Metrics for the area. Ultimately your initial assignment will help to familiarize you with our day to day business and work independently in a fast-paced and challenging work environment on a non-traditional shift schedule. 

 
What are we looking for?

Currently pursuing a degree in Commerce, Engineering, Supply Chain, or similar
Outstanding communication and interpersonal skills
Demonstrated commitment to working with and leading people
Proven problem solver and ability to manage competing priorities
Collaborative team-player with a "roll-up your sleeves" approach

Job Summary:
Get a glimpse of a real sales career at PepsiCo Beverages Canada during our 4 month Sales Co-op Program!
 
Who are we?
PepsiCo is making a difference on a global scale, and so can you! Competing in a dynamic, fast-paced industry, our ability to grow year after year is driven by our ability to attract, develop, and retain world class people who will thrive at PepsiCo.

We believe that delivering value for our consumers and customers, protecting our environment, sourcing with integrity and investing in our employees are not simply good things to do, but that these actions fuel our returns and position PepsiCo for long-term, sustainable growth.
 
Start Building Your Career
This is not a cold calling role. It is an opportunity to learn the fundamentals of sales and start your career with Canada's Top Employer for Young People! At PepsiCo Beverages Canada, the Sales Co-op role is a stepping stone to our Sales Leadership Program, specifically designed to develop new graduates into future sales leaders.
 
Make an Immediate Impact
During your Internship you will contribute to our success by executing exceptional sales & customer service within your territory and team, while selling the world's best known brands, including Pepsi, Gatorade, Pure Leaf and Bubly. You will work alongside our local field selling leaders to learn the business from the ground up.
Job Responsibilities:
You will bring some of the best known brands to life in store through exciting national and local programs like Super Bowl, Grey Cup, and NHL programs!
You will foster and build relationships with our customers to help them grow our brands
You will make an impact by achieving sales targets, market share, product distribution, and customer service targets
You will be part of a bigger team and have the opportunity to support branch targets by communicating with different departments
You will have the opportunity to be a part of volunteer opportunities, charity events or other passion projects through our Employee Resource Groups (ERGs)
You will be merchandising our brands and building exciting displays to grow sales
You will spend part of your internship taking on exciting projects related to delivering results and present your findings to our leaders
Required Skills:
You are available to work from May 2021 to the end of August 2021
You are graduating before August 2022
You are enrolled in an undergraduate program at an accredited University
You have experience with people - customer service work, volunteering, associations or societies
You have experience with a team environment - varsity or club sports, case study teams, members of an executive for a society or association are all great examples of team environments
You have the ability to work independently and get results - educational achievements or work experience count for this
You have time management and organization skills - managing your class workload, extra curricular activities and/or your work experience
You demonstrate solid communication skills - from school presentations, extra curricular activities and/or work experience
You possess a valid class 5 driver's license and have access to a vehicle - this is a non-negotiable job requirement
You are able to perform the physical aspects of the job involved in display building, and merchandising our products - you need to be comfortable lifting and standing for most of the day
Targeted Degrees and Disciplines:

				- Theme - Business Administration
				
			
				- Theme - Finance and Investment 
				
			
				- Theme - Insurance and Risk Management 
				
			
				- Theme - Marketing and Communication

				- Theme - Quality Assurance and Control 
				
			
				- Theme - Sales and Business Development 
				
			
				- Theme - Supply Chain Management and Logistics

Job Summary:
PerkinElmer is a $2.2 billion global technology leader focused on making a difference to improve human and environmental health. Everyday, we provide our customers with critical knowledge, expert and innovative detection, imaging, informatics and service solutions so that they can make better decisions for better outcomes. Our solutions enable earlier detection of disease, more effective therapeutics, cleaner drinking water and safer food, positively impacting the quality and longevity of life.

PerkinElmer is backed by an outstanding team of 7,600 employees in over 150 countries across the world. PerkinElmer accelerates scientists' ability on the front lines to detect, monitor and manage environmental contaminants and toxic chemicals while ensuring safety and compliance issues are addressed and people are protected.
Job Responsibilities:
This Co-op position is based in our Woodbridge, ON office.
The Co-op student will be working alongside a strong R&D team to help design and build new scientific instruments for our organization.
Required Skills:
Basic parametric CAD experience (Solidworks preferred)
Basic knowledge or past experience with mechanical design
Some knowledge of ISO drafting standards and practices
Creative and willingness to learn


Preferred but not required:

Experience with FEA for structural/strength analysis, fluid and thermodynamics
Knowledge of heat transfer fundamentals
Knowledge of strength of materials and material compatibility

				- Theme - Manufacturing and Process Engineering
				
			
				ENG - Mechanical and Mechatronics Engineering
				
			
				ENG - Systems Design and Biomedical Engineering

Job Summary:
We are transforming the internal digital experience at PerkinElmer. We are a company with R&D staff around the world and we are working to bring our staff closer together.
We will be experimenting with our various communication channels (Slack/MS Teams/MS Sharepoint) to deliver more stories about the exciting projects and innovations that we are doing within our teams. We will also be experimenting with new forms of communication (video, Podcasts etc) to get staff more closely connected.

We are strategically located at the Tannery Hub in Kitchener, allowing you to easily interact with startups of all stages and other enterprise innovation labs to stay well-informed about advanced tech. 

We are looking for enthusiastic individuals to join our Digital Strategy Team to help us map out new media channels and cool stuff. If you got what it takes, let's talk!
Job Responsibilities: Involvement of selection and content creation for various internal media channels within the PerkinElmer global R&D group.
Required Skills:
Enthusiastic about science and technology, Blog or Podcast experience, Prior community management experience and Video editing are a huge plus
If you don't meet the required skillset we still encourage you to apply!

Job Summary:
We are transforming our software offerings to improve accuracy, throughput, and overall customer experience. This means a simplified user interface, a streamlined workflow, and an extendable software base through vertical apps and add-ons with built-in machine learning capabilities. We spend most of our days doing the following:
1) building machine learning prediction models using advanced frameworks/libraries
2) testing these models using our blazing fast NVIDIA GPU box to solve interesting problems
3) experimenting with advanced tech to automate most of the workflow
4) brainstorming solutions to reduce machine downtime 
5) improving overall ease-of-use 
6) discovering new user experiences

We are strategically located at the Tannery Hub in Kitchener, allowing you to easily interact with startups of all stages and other enterprise innovation labs to stay well-informed about advanced tech. 

We are looking for enthusiastic individuals to join our technical team to help us develop innovative software experiences and cool stuff. If you got what it takes, let's talk!
Job Responsibilities: Involvement of full product life cycle and software development using modern tech stack and machine learning toolkits.
Required Skills:
Technical: Python, Data Science/ Machine Learning frameworks & libraries (PyTorch, TensorFlow, Scikit-Learn, etc), Agile Mindset, Git, Web/ Mobile App Development, JavaScript, Research
 
Other: Team Player, Quick Learner, Problem Solver with an Entrepreneurial Spirit

Job Summary:
Opportunity Overview
Come build product for a high-growth startup in the Fintech space. Reporting directly to the CEO, we are hiring two Software Developers who will work primarily in Javascript and with technologies such as React, Firebase, Cloud Functions, Cloud Firestore, Stripe, and many other modern tools and frameworks.  

This is an opportunity for someone to help design and make an immense impact at a fast-growing company. You should value and practice transparency, have the humility to accept your weaknesses, and continuously strive to improve personally and professionally.

About PerkUp
PerkUp drives employee engagement by allowing companies to issue pre-loaded credit cards to their employees to spend freely on perks they actually want, such as child care, wellness, fitness, home office, and education. These pre-loaded credit cards are marketed as "perk cards" and only work with merchants that are supported by PerkUp and approved by the employer. 

In today's work environment, companies must innovate beyond free lunches in order to effectively acquire top talent, improve engagement, and retain high performers. Outside of traditional benefits, it's difficult for HR and finance teams to deploy perk programs that are flexible, inclusive, tax-efficient, and easy to manage. Most companies manage cumbersome and cost-inefficient reimbursement processes or issue a cash stipend which is treated as salary.
Job Responsibilities:
Write Typescript/Javascript on the frontend and backend
Architect, design, and develop new features while using Firebase Authentication, Hosting, Firestore & Functions
Build components in React while leveraging a component design library
Integrate platform with Stripe Payments, Connect, and Issuing
Talk to customers and contribute to the product roadmap
Coordinate with product, design, and marketing on the release of new features
Take ownership, research, explore and deliver novel experiences 
Help define engineering best practices and processes
Required Skills:
You have experience writing Javascript for client-side web or mobile runtimes
You are familiar with modern Javascript language features, and tooling
You have experience debugging issues in a variety of browsers
You have an eye for great user experience (UX)
Willingness to go beyond what you know today
Good oral and written communication in English
Nice to have: experience maintaining and contributing to open source projects
Nice to have: experience writing Node.js applications

				- Theme - Computing: Software

Job Summary:
https://perpetua.io/

Who We Are:
Perpetua's mission is to transform digital advertising from a painful manual chore with uncertain results into a delightful experience that can predictably impact a company's bottom line. We help companies with world-class products and brands win on Amazon by analyzing large amounts of data and using AI to develop smart optimization algorithms that drive transformational sales growth.

Perpetua was founded by ex-Palantir engineers with strong backgrounds in applied data science from jobs at hedge funds and investment banks. We're leveraging technology to tackle the $1 Billion+ Amazon advertising space currently served by independent consultants.

As a fullstack software engineer you will join one of our feature squads, taking on responsibilities equal to a full-time engineer to deliver cutting-edge new features to our advertising platform. On this team you will get the opportunity to touch both our backend infrastructure and frontend clients, and refine your role over time based on your passion.
Job Responsibilities:
What You'll Do:
- Jump in to building the core infrastructure that powers the Perpetua platform
- Build features end-to-end including our web app and two native mobile clients
- Collaborate with the engineering team and take on responsibilities equal to a full-time engineer
- Work closely with design and product management to meet user requirements
- Work with cutting-edge technologies and large scale data pipelines
Required Skills:
Who You Are:
You're an ambitious software engineer looking to work on exciting and challenging problems.
You excel in a fast-paced environment and love to build software that is truly impactful.

Things You Should Have:
- Experience with server or full-stack development
- Knowledge (or willingness to learn) Python, React

Job Summary:
https://perpetua.io/

Who We Are:

Perpetua's mission is to transform digital advertising from a painful manual chore with uncertain results into a delightful experience that can predictably impact a company's bottom line. We help companies with world-class products and brands win on Amazon by analyzing large amounts of data and using AI to develop smart optimization algorithms that drive transformational sales growth.

Perpetua was founded by ex-Palantir engineers with strong backgrounds in applied data science from jobs at hedge funds and investment banks. We're leveraging technology to tackle the $1 Billion+ Amazon advertising space currently served by independent consultants.

Perpetua's Design Team is responsible for delivering a cohesive end-to-end user experience to all of our customers, both by look and feel. A high quality user experience is increasingly important to us, as it allows us to target the widest range of customers. As a UI/UX designer on the team, you'll be collaborating closely with product and engineering to design new features for both our web and mobile clients, while also continuing to evolve our design standards.

- Lead projects from end-to-end as the key Design stakeholder responsible for successful solutions
- Work closely with design and product management to build the best possible UX
- Collaborate closely with the frontend team and take on responsibilities equal to a full-time designer
- Evolve our design standards and contribute to improving the look and feel of our platform in general
- Effectively communicate your design concept to stakeholders with thoughtfulness and confidence

- Proficiency with Sketch, Figma, and prototyping tools like Invision and Principle
- Experience designing responsive web and native mobile products from ideation to implementation

- Experience building and/or working with Design Systems
- Graduation with Bachelor's and/or Master's within 2 years
- Great communication skills ? You present design decisions and processes clearly and confidently, regardless of audience
- Great time management and ability to work under pressure

- Experience with motion design

Job Summary:
https://perpetua.io/

Who We Are:
Perpetua's mission is to transform digital advertising from a painful manual chore with uncertain results into a delightful experience that can predictably impact a company's bottom line. We help companies with world-class products and brands win on Amazon by analyzing large amounts of data and using AI to develop smart optimization algorithms that drive transformational sales growth.

Perpetua was founded by ex-Palantir engineers with strong backgrounds in applied data science from jobs at hedge funds and investment banks. We're leveraging technology to tackle the $1 Billion+ Amazon advertising space currently served by independent consultants.

The Perpetua Engine Team is responsible for developing the core algorithms and infrastructure that drive all of our advertising strategies. This includes running large scale AB tests, utilizing ANOVA, t-tests and various forms of significance testing to analyze the results, which inform upcoming features.

NLP techniques, probabilistic graphical modelling, Markov chains, Bayesian methods and Linear Programming are a few techniques that drive analysis of client data to form generalized methods for optimization within the Engine. The team is also responsible for supporting these methods with a distributed system made up of data pipelines that coordinate interaction between multiple microservices to deliver reliably low processing times at scale.
Job Responsibilities:
What You'll Do:
- Jump in to building the core infrastructure that powers the Perpetua Engine
- Collaborate with the backend team and take on responsibilities equal to a full-time engineer
- Work closely with design and product management to meet user requirements
- Iterate with the data science team to deploy insights in an intuitive way to end customers
- Work on cutting-edge advertising algorithms, multiple microservices and large scale data pipelines
Required Skills:
Who You Are:
- You're an ambitious software engineer looking to work on exciting and challenging problems.
- You excel in a fast-paced environment and love to build software that is truly impactful.

Things You Should Have:
- Experience with server or full-stack development
- Knowledge (or willingness to learn) Python
- Graduation with Bachelors and/or Masters in Computer Science or other related field within 2 years
- Demonstrated experience and passion working with cutting-edge software

Job Summary:
Petro-Canada Lubricants Inc. (PCLI), located in Mississauga, Ontario is seeking a 4 or 8 month Plant Engineering student. You will provide timely, high quality engineering support to the maintenance and operations departments at the lubricants centre. This role is situated within the engineering office at the lubricants plant with frequent opportunities to gain field experience in an operating petrochemical facility.

Job conditions require sitting, twisting, stooping, crouching, kneeling, talking or hearing, making visual inspections, climbing stairs, climbing ladders, reaching or grasping, lifting and/or carrying up to 5lbs, pushing and/or pulling up to 5lbs. Job conditions may require standing and walking.
 
ENVIRONMENTAL, HEALTH, & SAFETY RESPONSIBILITIES:
Our primary values at HollyFrontier are: We put health and safety first; we care about the environment.

All HollyFrontier employees are expected to work safely every day and be safety & environmental leaders. This includes active participation in the following:

Stops and/or reports any unsafe work or conditions
Follows safety & environmental policies and procedures
Supports safety & environmental goals and initiatives
Participates in safety & environmental meetings, training, emergency drills and hazard recognition programs
Reports all accidents, injuries and near misses, and participates in associated investigations
Participates in industrial hygiene, medical surveillance and behavior based safety programs  

About Petro-Canada Lubricants
Petro-Canada Lubricants blends and packages more than 350 different lubricants, specialty fluids and greases that are exported to more than 80 countries on six continents. Petro-Canada Lubricants specializes in products and services proven to maximize equipment performance, productivity and overall savings. From heavy duty engine oils to hydraulic fluids, automatic transmission fluids and gear oils and greases, Petro-Canada Lubricants is committed to delivering innovative solutions that deliver value and keep your business moving.
 
Join Petro-Canada Lubricants Inc. where you have the opportunity to develop and own your career!
 
About HollyFrontier Corporation
HollyFrontier Corporation, headquartered in Dallas, Texas, is an independent petroleum refiner and marketer that produces high value light products such as gasoline, diesel fuel, jet fuel and other specialty products. HollyFrontier operates through its subsidiaries a 135,000 barrels per stream day ("bpsd") refinery located in El Dorado, Kansas, a 125,000 bpsd refinery in Tulsa, Oklahoma, a 100,000 bpsd refinery located in Artesia, New Mexico, a 52,000 bpsd refinery located in Cheyenne, Wyoming and a 45,000 bpsd refinery in Woods Cross, Utah. HollyFrontier markets its refined products principally in the Southwest U.S., the Rocky Mountains extending into the Pacific Northwest and in other neighboring Plains states. In addition, HollyFrontier, through its subsidiary, owns Petro-Canada Lubricants Inc., whose Mississauga, Ontario facility produces 15,600 barrels per day of base oils and other specialized lubricant products and owns a 37% interest (including a 2% general partner interest) in Holly Energy Partners, L.P.
Job Responsibilities:
Reviews and field checks reported maintenance problems to develop engineered solution
Designs process piping repairs and improvements based on corporate and industry standards
Drives safety mindset through site programs like field level risk assessments and peer observations
Supports plant equipment and instrumentation upgrade designs
Leads various engineered projects from early scoping to construction and close out 
Special assignments or tasks assigned to the employee by their supervisor, as determined from time to time in their sole and complete discretion.

EXPERIENCE:

Currently enrolled in 3rd or 4th year of a Mechanical/Electrical/Chemical Engineering degree program at an accredited post-secondary institution.  Attach your transcripts with your application in order to be considered; clearly indicate the length of work term for which you are available.
 Must possess a valid driver's licence
 Prior industry experience is preferred
 Hourly rate will be determined based on the number of academic and work terms that have been completed

Student enrolled in an undergraduate Mechanical/Chemical or Electrical Engineering degree program and returning to full-time studies after the work term to be eligible.

Advanced computer skills, particularly in MS Word, Excel and PowerPoint
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills (both verbal and written)
Motivated, self-starter who can work well independently or within a team environment
Strong analytical and problem solving skills
Excellent time management skills
The ability to multi-task

Job Summary:
Pioneer Hi-Bred Production Company a division of Corteva Agriscience is seeking hard working, motivated, and independent co-op students for the position of Research Assistant Doubled Haploid located in Caledon, Ontario.

This temporary position offers employees a unique opportunity to work in a leading edge plant biotechnology laboratory involved in cell biology R & D to improve the oilseed crop, canola.  Canola is a high quality rapeseed used especially for its "healthy" oil and one of the major oilseed crops in Canada and Europe.  The successful candidate will be part of a highly successful and motivated multi-disciplinary group involved in canola improvement. This is a preferred 8 month position however 4 month co-ops maybe considered.  The facility is 20 minutes from Brampton and 25 minutes from Mississauga and 45 minutes from Guelph or Toronto.  The facility is located just east of Georgetown, on the corners of Mayfield and Mississauga Roads.
Job Responsibilities:
Duties and responsibilities for this position will be as follows:

- Assist with microspore culture to create double haploid canola breeding lines.
- Regenerate doubled haploid plants from microspore-derived embryos including embryo in vitro culture, shoot sub-culture and plant transfer to soil.
- Assist researchers to collect a large amount of samples from DH shoots
- Assist with research to improve doubled haploid procedure.
- Maintain proper records for lab processes, instrument performance and communicating effectively with team members and supervisor.

This position will be involved primarily in canola doubled haploid production, research and routine activities.  Employment period is for three months or more based on requirement.
Required Skills: The ideal candidate would possess the ability to work under minimal supervision after an initial training period to achieve the research and production goals in a team environment.

At Pixlee, we look for talented, high-potential individuals who aren't jerks. Our proposition is simple: Pixlee offers a unique opportunity to thrive and grow rapidly in a small-team startup environment operating at big-company scale.

We're looking for determined and hungry individuals who thrive under pressure to join our Software Engineering team in Toronto. It will be your job to help us design, build, and deliver the Pixlee platform to companies and organizations around the world to revolutionize how people connect to the brands they love. 

Our team is currently working remotely, but we hope to return to optional office attendance a few times a week in the future. As the Covid situation evolves we will continue to evaluate our policy to ensure all of our team is safe, comfortable and productive.

Check out https://www.pixlee.com to learn more about us! You can also check here to read about some of our previous co-op's experiences working at Pixlee
Job Responsibilities:
As a key member of our engineering team you will:

- Work closely with designers, PMs and engineers to tackle challenging problems in the ecommerce and content marketing space, and lead feature projects from start to finish
- Use your experience to expand engineering best practices, tooling, QA/testing, documentation, and other key processes for our growing team
- Lead projects across a variety of Pixlee services including scalable back-end APIs, beautiful consumer-facing galleries, and our curation platform, just to name a few
- Consistently challenge and influence the direction of our product offerings with confidence through both technical and user focused thinking
- Leverage your expertise across the entire tech stack to build and improve our Rails and Javascript based applications at scale
- Communicate clearly with the customer success team and customers themselves to ensure they are getting maximum value from all of our product offerings
- Apply your infrastructure and scripting knowledge to support team wide DevOps initiatives and engineer enablement work
Required Skills:
Essential skills to help you succeed at Pixlee:

Product Mindset - Approach problems from the perspective of our users with a "product first" mentality to deliver intuitive and easy/fun to use products which provide maximum value to all of our customers.
Engineering Excellence - Tackle projects with technical feasibility, efficiency and best practices in mind. Always strive to improve scalability and make the life of all other engineers easier through clean, reusable code
Seek Ownership - Take pride in your work and strive to create an ever growing set of tools and features which resonate with you. Be comfortable questioning the status quo and always pushing yourself and others to rethink how we as a team approach problems.
Pragmatism - Balance innovation and product stability effectively to continually push the envelope while meeting deadlines under quickly changing conditions 


Some of the tech you'll be playing with:

-Javascript (Backbone, Marionette, React)
-Ruby/Rails
-HTML/CSS/LESS
-Kubernetes/Docker/AWS
-Elasticsearch
-PostgreSQL, MongoDB
-Scala/Play
-Python

Job Summary:
Due to Covid-19, our employees continue to work from home. PointClickCare will ship out a work laptop/necessary equipment for your work term.

Have you ever wanted to be at the founding stages of defining and building a whole new large-scale SaaS platform?  Does finding solutions to complex issues and concurrently figuring out if it can also scale and perform not only have you curious - but drives that passion in you as an engineer?

Meet the Team:
The Product Engineering team is our largest business unit yet, and we are on a journey to evolve into a World-Class Organization. Although the leadership style may vary depending on who you will report to, there is a foundational approach that we live and breathe every day. These are the behaviors that are critical to us: 

We work in the open
We set public deadlines with concrete deliverables
We don't bury the lead
We make evidence driven decisions
We learn from our mistakes

You will work with Sensors, API's, 3rd parties, mobile apps, hybrid apps, and modern web frameworks (like VUE & React). 
You will collaborate cross-functionally with other Engineers, and business analysts to specify, design, develop, test, and implement software. They're all great people to work with. Trust me. 
Time permitting, debate Star Wars versus Star Trek.

We're a cloud-based software provider for the senior care market in North America. We're also the industry leaders in terms of growth potential and our expansion into new markets of Senior Care. What does a Business Systems Analyst Co-op do?

Reporting to the Manager of Corporate Systems, the Business Systems Analyst (BSA) plays an important role as a liaison between the Corporate Systems team and the broader employee base of PointClickCare. Job Summary:
Polar
Polar CEO and UW Alumnus, Kunal Gupta, is hosting virtual information sessions on January 14, 2021 from 4:00-5:00pm and January 15, 2021 from 12:00-1:00pm. For more information and to find the link to the sessions, go to https://www.grapevine.fit/.

To be considered for this role, you must apply through the Grapevine website student application (https://www.grapevine.fit/student). 

The Business
Polar provides creative advertising technology to 200+ media agencies and publishers in 30+ countries. Ad agencies and publishers use Polar's product to build high-impact digital ads. This makes it easy for advertisers to repurpose their ads from Facebook and Instagram to run on websites. 5,000+ advertisers have already run 10 billion ads with Polar in 2020. 

The Co-op Experience
Polar was founded by UW alumni in 2008, before it was cool for young people to start companies. 200+ UW co-ops have chosen Polar over the past decade. The CEO, Kunal Gupta, started Velocity and was involved with leading many entrepreneurial programs on campus which have contributed to the UW culture you might experience today. Visit bykunal.com to learn more about the CEO and check out his blog.

Polar is proud of the exciting careers many previous co-op students have pursued. 

Polar's approach to co-op is unique. Here, you will:
- Partner with an experienced mentor to support you
- Gain exposure to the entire business and team, including the CEO

Students working with Polar get exclusive access to The Collective?a learning program and community tailored to equipping you with everything you need to be successful in your career. This program is specifically dedicated to helping you learn and grow alongside other entrepreneurial-minded students, as you learn how to make the best of your time as a co-op. 

The Culture
Polar's approach to how work is unique and aligns with where the world is headed, versus where it once was.
Work From Anywhere: a fully distributed team with no offices, on a long-term basis.
The Someday Experiment: a four day work week, giving everyone their "Someday" today.
Flow Day: get the most work done through the Slack-light culture and limited distractions
Wellness & Balance: focused and efficient work promoted through mindfulness and compassion.

Visit polar.me/culture to learn more about Polar's culture
Visit somedayexperiment.com to learn more about the four day work week.

This is a Marketing & Communication Fellowship, working directly with client-facing leaders in Canada, the US, UK and Australia. Job Title: Software/Web Developer Marketing and Analytics Platform
Job Summary:
Polaris Intelligence is an innovative company developing cutting-edge online data analytics applications for businesses to gain market and consumer insights. Our online analytics platform provides businesses with indispensable strategic consumer data, as well as spatial and analytical intelligence for sustainable growth. Our clients range from individual franchisees, to Fortune 500 retailers, to real estate companies and international consulting firms. Ideally, the co-op will have web development experience and work on web development. At a minimum the co-op student will do some QA.


Our Tech Stack
We use JavaScript in a Symfony framework. We want to use some React. We are also in the middle of implementing a RESTful API. Bring your toolkit of skills and help us make choices about our environment going forward.
Job Responsibilities:
Co-ops get the opportunity to make a large impact. Previous co-ops have modernized the look of our webapp, developed a regression testing framework in Python from scratch, built on existing code to create new data products, and written the user manual that all new employees and clients receive.


Possible Responsibilities:

Work on various web development projects, hopefully with some React
Learn from and share knowledge in weekly code reviews, biweekly codebase architecture meetings, weekly demos
Software QA

Job Summary:
About Precision NanoSystems Inc. (PNI)
Precision NanoSystems Inc. (PNI) is a global leader of innovation solutions for the discovery, development, and manufacture of gene and precision therapies used in oncology and rare and infectious diseases. PNI is enabling the future of Biotechnology by committing to our mission of accelerating the creation of transformative medicine that significantly impacts human well-being.
This year, we are celebrating our 10th year anniversary with over 350 NanoAssemblr instruments deployed worldwide (including the top 25 large pharma companies) and more than 200 publications that feature our technology.
Job Responsibilities:
Areas of Responsibility
The Microfluidics Engineer Co-op will be a key member of the growing R&D team at PNI. The successful candidate will be responsible for supporting the company's scientific and product development goals, which includes the following key responsibilities: 
 
-Design, fabrication and characterization of microfluidic devices, specifically devices enabling new capabilities for PNIs technology
-Application development for new microfluidic devices
-Design and fabrication of instruments for operating microfluidic devices
-Assist in transitioning new instruments to manufacturing
-Liaise with outside contractors and suppliers
-Liaise with collaborators to support shared research goals and make adjustments to prototypes as necessary
Required Skills:
Qualifications and Experience
The successful candidate must have a keen interest in nanotechnology and life sciences, be a quick learner and motivated to help the company grow and succeed. 
-Studying Engineering Physics, Systems Engineering or any other multi-disciplinary degree.
-Experience or knowledge of microfabrication.
-Strong biological lab techniques.
-A working knowledge of any major programming language.
-Experience within the design and building of prototype instruments.
-Experience with Solidworks or other 3D cad software.
-A working knowledge of electronics and PCB design.

Targeted Clusters

Job Summary:
Preformed Line Products (PLP) has been designing and manufacturing in Canada since 1985. Our ISO9001-certified manufacturing facilities serve transmission & distribution power utilities and communications customers across Canada.  Our company produces electrical cable attachment hardware, motion control products, fiber splicing closures, polymer insulators and wildlife protection products.
 
We are looking for a candidate to join our Engineering team and support our local design and process development activities.  Our students participate in a variety of tasks including product design and modeling, manufacturing document management, quality control support, process analysis, and validation testing.  The successful candidate will work closely with our Engineers to complete various projects but also be responsible for their own independent work. 

This position is an on-site role.  PLP is taking precautions related to the prevention of the spread of covid-19.  Social distancing practices are employed and engineered solutions are used when distancing is not possible.
Job Responsibilities:
Responsibilities include:
- Creation and management of 3D models and 2D drawings
- Control of manufacturing documents such as bills of materials and job routings
- Conduct product validation testing
- Support the Production and Quality teams by reviewing product and process data, conducting inspections and designing test fixtures
- Participate in regular department meetings

- 3D modeling (ProE CREO preferred but not mandatory)

Job Summary:
Prime Design Build Corporation is a growing general contractor in the Toronto area that manages construction projects in the residential, commercial, institutional and industrial sectors from conception through successful completion.
 
Candidates will work closely with project managers, having direct access to senior staff with P. Eng., E.I.T. and G.S.C. credentials, and will gain valuable experience in the entire construction process; including on site assignments, preparation and administration of job budgets, control of changes, drawing control and dissemination, attendance at job site subcontractor and safety meetings, working with the project manager and site staff to achieve the project schedule, preparation of cost estimates for change order and audit purposes, and in general achieving the overall project goals.
 
Prime provides a flexible, dynamic, fast paced workplace, professionally managed in a positive team environment. Candidates must be interested in construction estimating and/or project management as a career.

The principals of Prime Design Build Corporation have hired many students from this program as permanent staff, and use this program to train and to prospect for future employees. 

For more information about Prime and the types of projects we've been involved in, visit our website at http://www.primedb.ca/.
Job Responsibilities:

Coordinate with subcontractors
Create digital O&M manuals
Prepare bid packages, solicit and evaluate bids
Assist with planning and budgeting for projects, developing, preparing and disseminating documents, correspondence and materials as needed
Provide construction administration assistance, including issuance of change orders, contracts, and agreements for project
Monitoring long lead times interacting with consultants, clients and contractors.
Maintain cost ledger and job cost estimates and statements to ensure assigned projects remain on budget and schedule during construction
Review vendor invoices for accuracy and proper job costing and make the required changes prior to approval for payment
Ensure they are well versed in and consistently follow and enforce Prime's safety program procedures and policies
Make decisions to ensure that safety remains a top priority
Assist with accounts payable processing and payment

Job Summary:
Prodigy is an e-learning company that provides students around the world with a fun, engaging game to practice math skills. We are growing exponentially and have been recognized through numerous accolades including: Fastest-Growing Software Company by Canadian Business, Canada's Technology Fast 50 and the North American Fast 500, but are humbled by the fact that we still have a long way to go to accomplish our mission of helping every child in the world to love learning

If you are interested in joining us on this journey to make learning fun and are excited by our "sky's the limit" mentality we'd love to hear from you.

In the last 9 years, Prodigy has gone from 3,000 to over 90,000,000 students across the globe (including 80% of all Ontario students) and is currently the fastest growing educational startup in North America. By joining our team, you will have the opportunity to help an entire generation of students to LOVE learning while working alongside some of the brightest and most passionate people in education and gaming.

As a Full Stack Developer Co-op at Prodigy, you will be part of an amazing team helping millions of kids learn math in an entirely unprecedented and fun way. You will get the experience of working on multiple products that help to support our game.
Job Responsibilities:
Your Impact:

You will experience every aspect of software development from design to deployment
You will participate in agile sprint planning, estimation and review processes
You will work collaboratively within high-performing scrum team to ensure the clarity of business and functional requirements
You will write and maintain high quality and well-documented code
You will look for ways to improve Prodigy's suite of web applications. We have an environment where good ideas win and your ideas could help shape our product.
Required Skills:
Who You Are:

You demonstrate desire and ability to learn new applications and technologies quickly
You are passionate about building amazing products and experiences
You thrive on collaboration and enjoy working side by side with people from different backgrounds and disciplines  
You have strong written and verbal communication skills

Bonus Points For:

Experience with JavaScript and its front-end frameworks (React, Angular, Backbone), HTML5, GraphQL or Node.js
Experience with unit testing and testing frameworks
Knowledge of relational or NoSQL databases
Knowledge of agile best practices or experience working in an agile environment
Targeted Degrees and Disciplines:
Targeted Clusters
			

		
		
			
				- Theme - Computing: Software
				
			
				ENG - Electrical and Computer Engineering
				
			
				ENG - Software Engineering
				
			
				ENG - Systems Design and Biomedical Engineering
				
			
				MATH - Computer Science

Job Summary:
Public Service and Procurement Canada (PSPC) is the backbone of the Government of Canada. We support the daily operations of nearly 106 federal departments and agencies, acting as the Government of Canada's central purchaser and property manager for one of the largest real estate portfolios in the country. The Environment, Health, and Safety Services Directorate (ES or EHS), often referred to as Environmental Services (ES), is part of the Technical Services Sector of Real Property Services within PSPC. EHS is organized around areas of expertise to support PSPC and other client departments with the best possible services to accelerate the greening of government operations. We help to establish government-wide priorities, accountabilities, targets, timelines and reporting requirements to assist the Government in its commitment to become a model of environmental excellence in its own operations. The Environmental Compliance, Operations Group for the National Capital Region is responsible to:
1-fulfill PSPC's own corporate environmental responsibilities and deliver services to clients in an environmentally responsible and due diligent manner.
2-achieve the federal environmental objectives and comply with all applicable regulatory requirements.
3-offer training and education programs to ensure that employees understand and fulfill their environmental obligations.

PSPC is committed to ensuring that their Federal clients meet or exceeds Federal environmental laws, regulations, standards and policies and, where appropriate, is consistent with municipal, provincial, national and international environmental standards!

As the Student Environmental Officer, you would support some of the following Programs under the Environmental Compliance, Operations (National Capital Area) Group from the Environmental Health and Safety, Technical Services, Real Property Services Branch:
-Environmental Assessment (Impact Assessment Act)
-Storage Tank Program (Storage Tank Systems for Petroleum Products and Allied Petroleum Products Regulations)
-Halocarbon Containining Equipment (Federal Halocarbons Regulations)
-Species at Risks (Species at Risk Act)
-Waste Water
-Due Diligence

The Student Environmental Officer will work with various team members within the Environmental Compliance team, project managers, and potentially other government departments and stakeholders when required. The Student Environmental Officer will become familiar with tools and procedures that allow for the interpretation and application of important federal environmental legislations and associated regulatory framework.

Job Summary:
Curious about working for the Government of Canada Join our dynamic team for the unique experience of shaping iconic heritage buildings in downtown Ottawa!
 
The Science and Parliamentary Infrastructure Branch (SPIB) at the department of Public Services and Procurement Canada (PSPC) is seeking to fill a Deputy Project Manager position to provide support to the Parliamentary Precinct Operations team. We are looking to leverage your unique interests and educational background to help us advance sustainability and engineering initiatives within the Parliamentary Precinct.
 
Our offices are located centrally in downtown Ottawa at 300 Laurier Avenue West, easily accessible by public transit; we are a five-minute walk from the Parliament O-Train station. Our Operations team is a diverse and inclusive group of project managers, and engineers that have lots of experience supporting students and student led projects. You will also join an existing team of students who often plan social activities and share lunch together.

Conducting research, performing analysis, and drafting documents and technical reports
Supporting the Environmental Sustainability Office team with ongoing projects and deliverables
Providing project management support to ensure projects are on time, on scope, and on budget
Preparing summary documents for management that inform policy and technical decisions

The candidate will have strong background working with and processing large datasets for analysis and reporting. Job Summary:
PURPOSE BUILDING - SUSTAINABILITY ANALYST

Do you love wicked problems? Do you like continuously improving what you are producing? Do you think learning is really fun? Do you think buildings must be good citizens of their community? So do we! Join Purpose Building and let's go Farther Faster, together!
 
WHO WE ARE
We created Purpose Building to accelerate real estate toward planet-positive pathways. We draw out the best of everybody to create a better future through healthy, circular, low-carbon, financially successful buildings.
 
We deliver market-leading strategies to achieve leading edge performance for new and existing facilities. We aim to be the premier provider of this service in the geographies we serve.
 
Our core values are:

Team Success - enable great lives for each other through commitment to the Mission
Collaboration Excellence - highly effective knowledge-building, partnerships and communication
Social Responsibility - contribute to the success of the communities we live and work in
Honesty - what you say is what you do
Job Responsibilities:
WHAT YOU WILL BE DOING
As a Sustainability Analyst, you will be responsible for analysis that supports delivering high performance design strategies on projects and maintaining the firm's best-in-class knowledge and reputation with respect to building performance. To achieve this, you will: 

Engage in continual learning to apply principles of energy/carbon/material flows in buildings, human comfort and business performance to contribute solutions to climate change
Research relevant real estate trends and technologies
Perform calculations, report on outcomes of the analysis and prepare presentations to help the team develop high performance design solutions for new and existing buildings
Contribute to the development of new ideas, workflows and tools for the Company
Apply problem-solving, communication, critical thinking and interpersonal skills
Required Skills:
WHO YOU ARE
We work with individuals who take initiative, enjoy solving difficult problems, listen very well and express themselves clearly, bring passion to their work, are fun to be with, are adaptable and are invested in personal betterment.
 
The skills and experience you bring include:

Proficiency in written and oral communication, using Excel, Word and PowerPoint
Best of market problem-solving, critical thinking and communication skills
Working knowledge of some of the following: Sustainability / Sustainable Design, Construction, Operations and Management, Real Estate, Business Management or Finance
Ability to deliver results that meets the scope, budget and schedule
At least 3 years of undergraduate studies in Architecture, Architectural Science/Technology, Mechanical/Electrical/Civil Engineering, Construction or Building Science
LEED GA/AP or WELL GA/AP accreditation is an asset

Job Title: AI Software Engineering Intern - QNN HTP Project
Job Summary:
We invent the tech the world loves.
Before there were smartphones or smart cities, before autonomous cars or 360° virtual reality videos, there was our technology. Qualcomm inventions are the foundational technologies that others build upon - inventing new industries and applications that have global impact. From 5G to artificial intelligence, from IoT to automotive and extended reality applications, Qualcomm is inventing the technologies the world loves.

At Qualcomm, students and college graduates jump right into next-generation technologies that are changing the wireless world. In a world where power and capabilities keep increasing to compete with other leading companies in the industry, Qualcomm knocks out its competition in almost every category.
Job Responsibilities: This intern will work with the team developing optimized software for AI engines utilizing parallel SW techniques and HW accelerators. Projects will also include development of AI runtime analysis tools, exposure to state of the art neural networks and use cases.

Job Summary:
Quanergy is building intelligent software solutions that interpret our LIDAR 3D sensor data to perceive the world around us.  In parallel to this software, Quanergy has developed an automated Performance Evaluation system to quantify performance using labeled truth data. 

We are looking for a motivated student who loves analyzing and plotting data to help us make conclusions about how well our software performs in various real-world scenarios. As part of the software team, you will learn about our Performance Evaluation system software, and use it to analyze our vision software performance.

- Design and implement test cases, generate new data using a 3D LIDAR simulator, analyze using Performance Evaluation system
- Produce performance results, analyze for trends, and report findings to team in a clear and concise manner.

Your work will also give you exposure to 3D LIDAR data and 3D tools such as a viewer and simulator, in addition to exposure to a Python-based automated testing framework.

Job Summary:
Our HQ is in San Francisco, CA a Y-Combinator backed company that helps secure smart contracts at scale using computer-aided reasoning tools, with a mission to help boost adoption of this exponentially growing technology.

Work with a diverse and talented team of PhDs from UWaterloo and security professionals with a wealth of experience. We come from companies like Google, Facebook, Apple, Goldman Sachs, BMW, Visa, and MathWorks. Together, we are here to do some of the best work of our careers, driving smart contract security while defining a new standard in blockchain security.

To date we have 100+ enterprise clients, get the experience of working with some of the most innovative and exciting projects using distributed systems and blockchain with Toyota, Siemens, Mitsubishi, eToro, Binance, MakerDao and more.

* Explaining to both technical and non-technical clients the way in which a vulnerability manifests, the methods and consequences of an exploit, and a recommended fix, often in the form of written reports
* Writing and evaluating tests
* Using static analysis tools to discover vulnerabilities (and weeding out the false positives)
* Assisting the protocol team from time to time with internal audits and protocol-level discussion
* Communicating with clients
Required Skills:
* Previous experience designing and/or evaluating distributed systems protocols
* Knowledge of how machines work

** Binary representation
** How memory is mapped

* Familiarity building and/or auditing smart contract projects preferred
* BS/BA in CS, Math, or equivalent experience
* Technical expertise in one of the following:

** Cryptography
** OS/Database security
** Programming languages/formal verification

* Familiarity with Solidity and JavaScript highly preferred
* Familiarity with blockchain relevant topics (tokens, AML/KYC, identity) a plus

Job Summary:
We're looking for our next Product Analyst. Could It Be You? 
 
As the fastest growing online brokerage in Canada, Questrade is committed to helping Canadians become much more financially successful and secure. Our vision is to revolutionize financial services by offering the most innovative and cost efficient financial services ? including banking. 
 
The Product Analyst, Digital Banking will play a meaningful role in developing and executing on Questrade's Digital Banking strategy, product and vision.  
 
What's it like working as a Product Analyst, Digital Banking at Questrade? 
 
You will support the strategic development of new digital banking products and services. Reporting to Product Manager, Digital Banking, you will assist in aspects of product management and product life-cycle, including product design and product features and research.
Job Responsibilities:
Questrade is looking for someone with strong business acumen, a foundational understanding for product design and management, creative thinking and strong research skills. In addition a desire to rethink banking products 
As the Product Analyst you will assist the Product Management team in the following areas. This will include but not be limited to: 
 
·         Product Planning and Roadmap: Ideate, design, develop, implement and manage the expansion of the digital banking product line and product features 
·         Revenue Optimization: Track key business metrics, analyze and evaluate product performance, develop supporting business cases and contribute to forecasting and P&L management 
·         Marketing: Work with internal and external Marketing partners on a "go-to-market" strategy, analytics and leads, acquisition strategy. Accountable for the continual usage and adoption of product 
·         Customer Experience: Represent Questrade's customers and prospects and develop/deliver an integrated customer experience that exceeds their expectations and meets Questrade's standards. Collaborate with internal colleagues to develop business requirements/user stories, and client journey roadmap 
·         Market & Industry Knowledge: Perform on-going competitive and market analysis, including global market trends and continually maintain a complete understanding of the Financial Services landscape as it relates to threats and opportunities for Questrade existing and future product
Required Skills:
·         Education: Currently studying within a Post-Secondary Degree in Commerce, Management, Economics, Finance, Engineering, Computer Science, etc. 
·         An asset if some existing experience in Product Analysis/Management 
·         Excellent communication skills -- verbal and written, across all levels including management 
·         Strong financial acumen and analytical skills, ability to interpret large sets of data and draw insights 
·         Ability to drive change and challenge status quo, deal with ambiguity and make informed recommendations

Job Summary:
iOS Developer
Raise Your Edge is an online poker community that offers teaching resources in the form of one on one coaching, online videos and courses and has recently ventured into creating software to serve the poker community with more scale.  Learn more about RYE and our products here: ranger.raiseyouredge.com/
Work closely with a UW graduate and former Software Engineer at Amazon with 10+ years in the software industry to build the latest in cutting edge mobile and web software for professional poker.  Learn to take professional level ownership over your projects and work at a high level with senior developers.  Learn to be a professional developer at the level required by the top companies in Seattle and San Francisco like Amazon, Google, Facebook, etc.  It is not expected that you come to the job knowing already how to perform at this level but rather that you come to work each day with a positive attitude and always looking to improve your performance and abilities from the day before.  We will select candidates based on the depth of their previous software development experience (especially mobile), intelligence and desire to improve and grow and as a software professional.

Job Perks:
Work remotely.  We are an international group and don't have a physical office.  The lead developer is based out of London, Ontario and will meet occasionally or as needed on campus at UW or at an agreed alternate location.  Stay at your place in Waterloo, live with your parents back home - we don't care where you work so long as you put in a quality, UW level effort for 40 hours a week for the duration of the work term.
One on one coaching and skills development.  Meet daily or as needed with the lead developer to improve your hard and soft development skills.  We believe in investing in our co-ops to help them reach their potential in return for their hard work and dedication to the project.
Work on the latest technologies and platforms.  We make native and webapps using the latest in Swift, Angular, Firebase, and more.  
Competitive compensation.  In addition to saving time and money by working remotely, we will pay you by the hour in accordance to your co-op experience and program.

Job Summary:
Raven is artificial intelligence for manufacturing. Raven Telemetry is a new and exciting technology start-up that is focused on making manufacturing better around the world. Here at Raven we are looking for smart, enthusiastic, and hard-working people with a desire to be involved in building a great product.

As members of the team, students will be exposed to a multitude of development tasks and have the opportunity to learn while working under the supervision of experienced software development engineers. As a small company, Raven gives students the ability to participate in meaningful work to develop and to refine their own skills while also making a difference in the company. Our goal is that at the end of the semester, you have helped move the company forward and have five awesome bullet points on your resume to show for it.
Job Responsibilities:
In this position as Full Stack Software Developer, you'll mainly focus on back-end development (Python, Android, Java, Docker, Linux, PostegreSQL, Mongo, Redis, CI/CD, Redis, data transformation, etc.), but you'll also have the chance to touch on front-end development (using technologies, e.g., HTML, CSS, Javascript, React, D3). You will have an active role in the daily activities of the Software Team. This role will include, but not limited to, participation in new software development, ongoing upkeep of existing company infrastructure, automation of processes, and data analysis.

Day to Day Activities Include:
- development of continuous integration and test infrastructure
- automation of internal tooling and of data analysis
- customer specific bug fixes
- configuration of devices
- support for the software team
Required Skills:
- experience with Python, Android, and/or Java (major asset)
- Linux command line knowledge (major asset)
- database knowledge (asset)
- version control tools, e.g., git (asset)
- organization, communication and teamwork skills
- project management experience
- attention to detail
- drive, drive and more drive

Job Summary:
Interested applicants must apply through WaterlooWorks and directly to the employer to be considered for this position (see "Additional Application Information" section).

What is the opportunity?
RBC Capital Markets is a part of the Royal Bank of Canada, one of the largest providers of financial services in the world. RBC ranks among the top five banks in North America by market capitalization and has one of the highest credit ratings of any financial institution in the world.

Internship opportunities exist within RBCCM for energetic, bright and talented undergraduates and graduates. The co-op program extends for 16 weeks and provides interns the opportunity to gain in-depth, hands-on experience while working and learning alongside our experienced market professionals.

In selecting intern candidates, we look for well-rounded individuals with a track record of outstanding academic achievement, proven technical and analytical skills and a diversity of extracurricular activities. Other essential qualities we look for include strong oral and written communication skills, leadership qualities, initiative and the ability to play a key role as a team member in a fast-paced and challenging work environment. Fluency in more than one language is an asset
Job Responsibilities:
What will you do?
This opportunity will be highly initiative-driven and in addition to set responsibilities the student will excel by seeking out their own opportunities to learn and add value. Key responsibilities include:

Researching news and information sources such as Bloomberg, Reuters, and any online media sources to develop consolidated reports, and information.
Creating the morning notes, mid-day update, energy/mining notes and market share/close notes that are distributed to clients and internally.
Analyzing trading volumes, trading values, internal communications and internal research reports to document and summarize trading activity
Support our Corporate Access Team - Help with Corporate and Analyst marketing data, events, etc
Complete various research projects which include: investment ideas, industry analysis, client analysis
Liaising directly with Equity Sales Professionals and Traders to complete special assignments and support as necessary
Improve processes - bring ideas for making things better.
Required Skills:
What do you need to succeed?
Must-have

Successful completion of a minimum of first year of a business/economics/finance or related degree
Basic market knowledge and a demonstrated keen interest in capital markets
Strong research abilities and excellent analytical and communication skills
Extremely motivated and able to take initiative in order to identify ways to add value and improve practices
Demonstrated problem-solving skills, business sense and the ability to multi-task and prioritize in high pressure environments
Proficient with the use of Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint and Outlook, etc.
Office hours tied to global markets:  6 a.m. to 6 p.m.

Nice-to-have


CSC and CPH preferred and enrolment in CFA a strong asset
Prior related work experience valued
Prior use of Bloomberg, Reuters Eikon preferred

Candidates have usually focused their studies on commerce or economics, although this is not a prerequisite.  Most importantly, candidates must demonstrate a desire to learn and an eagerness to make a meaningful contribution to the team environment at RBC Capital Markets.

Interested applicants must apply through WaterlooWorks and directly to the employer to be considered for this position (see "Additional Application Information" section).

What is the opportunity?
Our hands-on Summer Internship Program (SIP) welcomes students from all undergraduate programs, who are looking to gain valuable insight into our Global operations business. You will be assigned to a specialist team to help deliver projects and initiatives. With tasks assigned to develop your professional capabilities and understanding of our products and services, as well as frequent learning and coaching opportunities, the SIP is here to equip you with all the necessary skills you need to succeed at RBC. The I&TS Summer Program is also a direct opportunity for our I&TS Graduate Rotational Program.

At RBC Investor & Treasury Services (I&TS), undergraduates from a variety of academic backgrounds have the opportunity to engage in a fast-paced environment with a world-class reputation.  A premier provider to the world's leading asset managers and financial institutions, we place clients at the core of our operations. With offices in 17 countries, our global team is regularly recognized for its products, capabilities and dedication to client service excellence.
 
A specialist provider of asset services, custody, and payments services for financial and other institutional investors worldwide, I&TS is one of the five reporting divisions of the Royal Bank of Canada (RBC). Committed to helping clients thrive and communities prosper, RBC is the largest bank in Canada and one of the world's leading financial institutions, not just by market capitalization, global footprint or service diversity, but by reputation.
Job Responsibilities:
What will you do?
You will be placed within one team for the duration of the Summer, in order to:

Develop in-depth knowledge of your area of business through assisting with day-to-day priorities
Gain experience solving complex business challenges
Collaborate with your team on relevant and impactful work, identifying operational efficiencies and leveraging your creative problem-solving skills
Build your professional network and skills in an inclusive environment where fresh perspectives are  encouraged
Participate in a Global internship program, connecting you with colleagues around the world

Potential teams include:

Product & Client Experience
Operations (Fund Accounting, Transaction Management, Client Reporting, Shareholder Services)
Global Client Coverage (Sales)
Operational Risk

Internship opportunities are aligned to:

Automation & Process Re-Engineering
Client Engagement
Product & Digital Enablement
Finance (Fund Accounting, etc.)
Project Management
Required Skills:
We are looking for students graduating in December 2021 or Spring 2022 with:

A genuine interest in business operations
Critical thinking and analytical skills
An innovative problem-solving perspective when faced with unique challenges
A desire to be engaged in your community

Job Summary:
Interested applicants must apply through WaterlooWorks and directly to the employer to be considered for this position (see "Additional Application Information" section).

What is the opportunity?
RBC fosters a positive learning environment for students by providing support and resources to help your development. As the leading financial institution in the country and one of Canada's Top Employers for Young People, RBC is a great place to start your career. By applying to this role, you will be highlighted to 10 roles across Internal Audit (see descriptions below). Some roles are more focused on auditing, whereas others are more focused on the technical and data analytics in auditing.
Job Responsibilities:
What will you do?

Internal Audit works to review what's going on behind the scenes of all lines of business across RBC. It is the ideal work environment if you're interested in seeing how things work, are curious about digging deep into data to discover new things and like to use your imagination to make recommendations or drive insights. By joining us for a 4-month long position, you will be involved in a variety of challenging assignments, allowing you become familiar with a wide range of areas across RBC, while also strengthening the skills and knowledge you need to launch a successful career. Our students benefit from interesting work and networking opportunities, and are encouraged to collaborate on innovations.
Required Skills:
What do you need to succeed?

Be Curious. You don't have to have an audit or accounting background in order to be successful here. What we look for is someone who has an interest in understanding and learning about auditing principles and techniques. Someone who is able to think critically and isn't afraid to recommend an approach or challenge others' opinions in a constructive manner. Someone who has a passion for learning and personal development, and wants to spend their term collaborating with a diverse group of talented individuals.
Be Tech-Savvy. Internal Audit is a leader in finding innovative ways to use technology to be more efficient and impactful. Proficiency in Microsoft Office tools, including Word, Excel, PowerPoint and Excel, is required. Experience with data analytics tools such as Python and visualization tools like Tableau are also an asset.
Be Adaptable. We are a busy part of RBC where there is always a lot on the go. We are looking for someone who thrives in a dynamically changing environment with strong project management skills, allowing you to multi-task, prioritize and work independently under tight timelines.
Be Collaborative. Internal Audit is a supportive and welcoming environment, and we are looking for team players who proactively seek out development opportunities. Someone with excellent interpersonal skills and a positive attitude. Someone who demonstrates strong verbal and written communication skills, allowing you to work effectively with people across the organization.
