By applying to this job posting, you will be considered for over 10 roles available across RBC Finance including Technology & Operations, Capital Markets, Wealth Management, Personal and Commercial Banking, Internal Audit and Corporate Functions. Roles include: 

Human Resources Analyst
Pension Analyst
Compensation & Benefits Analyst
Human Resources Data Analyst
Recruitment Analyst
Job Responsibilities:
What will you do?

Support the day to day operations of the HR function to which you are assigned (sample areas include Compensation, Transformation, Recruitment, Learning and Development, Organizational Effectiveness) 
Act as a partner to and liase with business partners
Work with various visualization programs
Identify opportunities to improve and streamline current processes
HR modelling forecasting and analysis
Work with various visualization programs
Interpret data using careful business-grounded logic and analytics techniques to test controls, find exceptions, and discover insights and trends.
Participate in research, analyses and human capital assessments
Be responsible to develop and run HR models
Provide strong human capital governance, including assisting with monthly reporting cycle and related account reconciliations and standards of documentation

What do you need to succeed?
Must-have:

Currently enrolled in a Canadian post-secondary institution with a focus in human resources, business, psychology or a related discipline

Leadership acumen and a passion to apply it in a dynamic business environment
Excellent interpersonal and highly developed communication skills (verbal and written)
Able to work effectively and reliably under pressure
Creative and analytical thinker who is self-driven and capable of working in a fast paced environment
Able to work effectively and reliably under pressure
Excellent MS Office skills - Word, Outlook, Excel and PowerPoint

Interested applicants must apply through WaterlooWorks and directly to the employer to be considered for this position (see "Additional Application Information" section).

What is the opportunity?
Are you interested in the opportunity to work as a Credit Risk Analyst student? By applying to this job posting, you will be considered for positions available across the Group Risk Management group, specifically in the folllowing areas! 

Enterprise Risk
Market Risk
Wholesale Credit Risk
Counterparty Credit Risk
Job Responsibilities:
What will you do?

Enterprise Market Risk team is looking for a student to support various core priorities such as monitoring and analyzing risk exposures, conducting backtest investigation, improving Enterprise risk reporting system and developing strategic solutions for various regulatory requirements related to Market Risk.
 
Market Risk team provides independent and effective on-site monitoring, controlling and communicating on the nature and extent of all material market and trading credit risks and to ensure the implementation of and compliance with risk management policies and procedures. The incumbent will lead in developing and promoting a "Best in Class" risk oversight environment for the market risk associated with RBC's Counterparty Risk Trading business and activities
 
Wholesale Credit Risk team provides risk assessment and adjudication for complex Capital Markets transactions.  Through effective analysis of business and financial risk, GRM - Credit establishes borrower risk ratings and evaluates proposed client strategies and credit requests in order to provide comprehensive transactional analysis and approval recommendations. he analyst will have responsibility for analyzing and rating Investment Managers and Fund borrowers to whom RBC extends credit and adjudicating vanilla lending and trading transactions from Corporate Banking and Institutional Client & Credit Management ("ICCM") teams.
 
Counterparty Credit Riskt eam is looking for a student that will be mainly responsible for performing risk reporting processes to produce daily/weekly and other ad-hoc reports in margin lending, security lending and portfolio analysis. The student will also be responsible for providing quantitative support in OTC derivative transaction credit sizing by simulating potential future exposure, margin loan transaction credit adjudication process by assessing the market and liquidity risk profile of collateral or margined assets. Finally, the candidate will provide support in the automation and improvement of existing processes and reporting under the guidance of senior risk managers.
Required Skills:
What do you need to succeed?
Must-have:

Knowledge of market risk, derivative credit risk, including: Value-at-Risk measurement and back-testing, stress testing and scenario analysis, sensitivity analysis and p/l decomposition, derivative pricing, potential future exposure calculation
Self-motivated individual with a high level of analytical capabilities and attention to detail
Knowledge of markets and products including equity, bond, structured products as well as current and upcoming regulatory/compliance requirements
Excellent written and oral communication skills
Excellent team player with strong interpersonal skills
Ability to work under pressure and against tight deadlines
Good command of Excel, VBA programming and SQL
Progress towards an MBA, MA, MS or equivalent with emphasis in finance, economics, or a quantitative discipline is preferred

Nice-to-have:


CFA or FRM an asset
R and Python programming skills
Tableau

What is the opportunity?
The RBC Corporate Real Estate team manages more than 23 million square feet of real estate in approximately 2,000 locations across the globe.  RBC's real estate portfolio includes several different types of properties including office space, retail stores, client-facing office space, data centres, operations centres and other critical facilities. CRE's mission is to deliver cost effective real estate solutions that support the strategic goals of RBC's business units. By applying to this job posting, you will be considered for various roles avaialable within the Corporate Real Estate group!

Communications and Knowledge Management 
Workplace Strategy 
Technology Support/Business Intelligence
Business Controls
Operations

Those students working in Corporate Real Estate (CRE) will assist in providing comprehensive real estate solutions and portfolio strategy that address stakeholder needs. The Summer Intern will work directly with the CRE management team to provide both strategic and tactical advice on the provision of real estate services to the business platforms, balancing business requirements with long term optimal real estate planning. This role will also work cross-functionally across the CRE team.Your financial and business acumen, as well as your strong verbal and written communication skills, will make you a valuable asset in this role. This is an excellent opportunity to be a part of a winning organization and team!
Job Responsibilities:
What will you do?

Analyze, compile, and organize due diligence materials for senior management to assess upcoming lease expiries and other real estate opportunities from a strategic perspective
Work in collaboration as a trusted business partner with business platforms and functional units to understand their operational requirements as it relates to: occupancy needs, space utilization levels, workplace strategy, facility management, and critical environment requirements
Assist with the preparation of client presentations and other materials, which may include business case writing and financial modelling
Standardize processes and create templates
Create ad-hoc analysis to assist in special projects, as needed
Perform all other duties as assigned
Assist in investigate and identify (inputs to)processes and procedures and support the development of standards to satisfy audit requirements
Required Skills:
What do you need to succeed?
Must-have:

Working towards a Bachelor's or Master's degree from an accredited University
An interest in the Corporate Real Estate industry; prior experience is not required, but the ability and willingness to learn quickly is a must
Strong business acumen and analytical thinker
Excellent oral and written interpersonal skills, including the demonstrated ability to professionally communicate with senior management
Ability to work independently as well as be able to collaborate and work effectively in teams, with internal departments and build partnerships with stakeholders
Technical Skills: Microsoft Office proficiency - Word, Excel, PowerPoint

Nice-to-have:


Experience with Financial Analysis, including technical and practical knowledge of financial modeling
Experience with Process Mapping tools and best practices (e.g. Visio, iGrafix)
Experience with Data Visualization Tools (Tableau) would be an asset
Familiarity with Agile Ceremonies and Scrum is a considerable asset
Interest in Data Governance: ensuring space data is accessible and accurate through processes and  controls to insure integrity and accuracy of reporting/source system
Advanced Excel skills (VBA, Pivot Table, Macros..etc)

What is the opportunity?
Are you passionate about state of the art systems, best in class business processes, giving back to the community, learning how to negotiate a contract with a supplier, working on a team with procurement professionals, product professionals, and working alongside the best and brightest analysts and insights professionals? If yes, this is an opportunity to work within the Global Procurement department!
Job Responsibilities:
What will you do?
RBC Procurement? What is that? Well, the Global Procurement team is responsible for buying and negotiating all the services, products, and solutions that RBC needs to operate. That means we go to market, get quotes, negotiate with suppliers and try to get the best value (not just price) for RBC. We have a diverse and inclusive supply chain, and are active within our communities.  We source everything from pens to cloud computing solutions to sponsorship programs, the Olympics and the Canadian Open.
 
Procurement is a growing space for career seekers who have just completed their post-secondary education, a simple search of job boards reveals that there's no shortage of amazing opportunities within procurement!
 
Working closely with the Sr. Manager of Procurement, providing support to the Global Procurement team, the Summer Internship role is responsible for proactive support, including anticipating issues and initiating appropriate actions to ensure the most effective use of time during the internship. You will prioritize incoming requests and project assignments. You will work with various procurement applications, data analysis tools and resources providing, and provide support to teams such as our procurement solutions and services team, strategy and business insights team and the procurement sourcing execution team.
Required Skills:
What do you need to succeed?
Must-have:

Analytical thinking: Identifies relationships between data and information.
Detail oriented: Locating and collecting data from appropriate sources and analyzing it to prepare meaningful and concise reports that summarize the information.
Providing advice: Provides suggestions based on established information and precedent.
Teamwork: Work better with others to achieve mutual goals.
Problem solving: Work through issues critically and creatively to develop innovative solutions.

Nice-to-have:


Commercial contract related knowledge.
Supply chain knowledge.
Data analytics capabilities.

Interested applicants must apply through WaterlooWorks and directly to the employer to be considered for this position (see "Additional Application Information" section).

What is the opportunity?
As a member of the Portfolio Advisory Group, the Portfolio Management Co-op student helps advisors effectively manage portfolios for retail clients, with a focus on communication and publications, security selection, and portfolio construction across a range of financial instruments.  You will empower advisors with better capabilities around portfolio monitoring, planning, construction, vehicle selection, and ongoing management.
 
The Portfolio Advisory team is responsible for advising RBC WM Canada's ~1,800 Investment Advisors. The role deals more specifically with Canadian, US, and International equities, as well as overall considerations related to asset allocation and the market outlook. The team supports $170 bln in equity assets, including Canada's largest discretionary asset management program, and manages several different model portfolios, which have more than ~$10 billion of RBC DS client assets following their mandates. The team also manages a number of mandates on the firm's UMA platform. The team provides a considerable range of timely thought leadership through a broad range of internal and client-oriented media.
 
The ideal candidate should enjoy working in a team setting, be a strong problem solver and have the ability to interpret and articulate complex information. The breadth of asset classes covered and access to a large pool of intellectual capital translates into a fast paced, client centered, and advice driven environment.
Job Responsibilities:
What will you do?
The Portfolio Management Co-op will research, analyze, and provide administrative support to Portfolio Advisors. Job will entail writing significant content for the Morning and Mid-Day notes, morning conference call and other publications which rank amongst the most widely read documents within all of RBC Dominion Securities. Other functions include: researching individual companies, building Excel models, answering calls from investment advisors and learning to utilize a Bloomberg terminal.

Run numbers every morning to summarize the prior day's market activity.
Summarize every morning the top five leaders and laggards for TSX and S&P 500 from the prior day.
Assist in summarizing the company reports (Canada and US) from RBC CM research team.
Facilitate the 8:45am DS advisors conference call (average 200 attendees).
Create and compile a slide deck for the conference call.
Summarize the conference call in a key topics publication.
Draft, manage and publish the Month-In-Review (MIR) for DS advisors and their clients.
Complete the MIR process on a timely basis (within 5 business days of the prior month end) with minimal edits.
Gain proficiency with Bloomberg and pull data for advisors when requested
Gather information from company annual reports and investor presentations
Contribute to featured commentaries on trending topics
Portfolio Advisors do a number of client presentations and Portfolio Management Co-op Intern will be asked to assist with presentation construction, including chart and table creation.
Significant opportunity to build and enhance Excel tools that are frequently used by Investment Advisors.
Ongoing refinement of PAG publications to make them more effective and useful for IAs.
Required Skills:
What do you need to succeed?

Basic accounting and finance knowledge
Interest in financial markets
Strong Excel and PowerPoint skills
Works well under pressure
Highly Organized
Pro-active
Strong Interpersonal  and communication skills

What is the opportunity?
Reporting to the Associate Director, Actuarial & Risk Management of GRMI (Group Risk Management Insurance), the Actuarial Analyst will provide key technical actuarial assistance in completing monthly and quarterly financial reporting requirements, trade quantifications, and other asset related projects/strategies.
 
The analyst will understand the relationship between Insurance Finance and the Canadian Life & Health Actuarial team with an emphasis on the actuarial aspects of Life Insurance Financial and Canadian Asset Liability Method (CALM) reporting.
Job Responsibilities:
What will you do?

Assist with monthly asset trade quantification for Corporate Actuarial and their partners.
Assist with identifying and implementing improvements to quarterly CALM processes.
Assist with ad-hoc analysis related to Asset Liability Management (ALM) strategies.
Assist in CALM quarterly valuation processes and production of liability cashflows.
Understand and explain the CALM model (GGY Axis) and implement model enhancements.
Required Skills:

Must-have

Ability to communicate clearly and concisely to both a technical and non-technical audience.
Basic programming skills (VBA, SAS, R)
Proficient in MS Excel and other applications in the Microsoft office suite.
Experience with GGY Axis (Asset and Reinvestment modules).
Pursuing a degree in Mathematics/Statistics/Actuarial Science and actively pursuing an ASA/ACIA designation

Prior Co-op experience in similar roles.

Job Title:
NEW
									



										Actuarial Analyst, Canadian Actuarial & Risk
Job Summary:
Interested applicants must apply through WaterlooWorks and directly to the employer to be considered for this position (see "Additional Application Information" section).

What is the opportunity?
The Actuarial Analyst is a member of the Actuarial Implementation work stream on the IFRS17 project. The candidate will provide support for the following: coordination and production of liability cash flows from AXIS Actuarial valuation models, building of tools to automate reconciliations and AXIS output ETL, User Acceptance Testing of a vendor CSM calculation tool.
Job Responsibilities:
What will you do?

Generate liability cash flow output from AXIS valuation models to support the build of the IFRS17 CSM Prototype and the configuration of a vendor CSM calculation tool (write text)
User Acceptance Testing (UAT) of the vendor CSM calculation tool - design test cases, perform tests and document findings, investigate issues (write text)
Assist with identifying and implementing improvements to the process of generating actuarial output (e.g. coding/implementing AXIS job scripts)
Assist in developing automated tools for reconciliation, and transformation of AXIS output
Collaborate with other IFRS17 teams (Integrated Close Process & Finance IT work streams) to coordinate project deliverables
Other tasks related to the IFRS17 project as assigned
Required Skills:
What do you need to succeed?
Must-have

Working towards Bachelor's degree with a focus in Actuarial Science & any of Math/Statistics/Computer Science/Economics etc.
Able to work May to December for an 8 month co-op term. 
Ability to communicate effectively (both oral and written)
Programming skills (e.g. R, Python, SQL, SAS, VBA etc.), intermediate level experience with Microsoft Office suite (Work, Excel, Access)
Initiative - an independent thinker with strong collaboration, analysis, investigation skills
Ability to deal with ambiguity and flexibility to adapt to change

Nice-to-have


Prefer experience working with Moody's AXIS Actuarial software
Prefer knowledge of insurance products, actuarial concepts, IFRS 17 Standard and implications to insurance companies
Experience using analysis tools (Tableau, QlikView)

Experience or understanding of programming languages, databases, platforms, frameworks, design techniques and tools, code management tooling, and/or web technologies

What is the opportunity?
The Data Scientist role at RBC offers the opportunity to leverage RBC's data assets to develop innovative solutions in support of RBCs big data strategy. The position is mandated to aid RBC, as it develops next-generation applications to meet our customers' needs. Joining the RBC team as a Data Scientist, you will have the opportunity to analyze, design and implement data solutions to assist all business customers.
Job Responsibilities:
What will you do?

Utilizing the latest technologies available, designing and building data solutions to meet business needs
Be an active contributor to not only your individual team, but to the RBC development community
Constantly seek out better ways to do things, new tools, new technologies, new processes
Work on transformational projects delivering new value
Work as part of an agile team responsible for end-to-end delivery of business needs
Deploy production-scale solutions using the Hadoop Ecosystem, transforming statistical and machine learning models from single node architecture to parallel processing grid technology
Use business domain knowledge to independently lead the analytics process to identify valuable and innovative insights
Promote analytics across the enterprise to enable RBC to become a data-driven organization
Required Skills:
What do you need to succeed?
Must-have

Advanced programming skills in one or more of the following languages: Python or R
Extensive experience utilizing SQL scripts/querying
Proficient in building statistical and algorithmic models with complex and large datasets, including but not limited to: supervised statistical learning, clustering, natural language processing, recommendation systems, times-series analysis, experimental design (A/B testing), data visualization, deep learning
Expert in data extract, transform, and load processes with a variety of data types
Ability to perform complex data analysis on large volumes of data and present findings to stakeholders

Nice-to-have


Experience with big data technologies, primarily in machine learning and statistics function
Exposure to Apache Spark, Hadoop and Public Cloud technologies
Experience with big data processing tools like Spark and Hive
GitHub functionality and workflow experience/exposure
Experience with data serialization (JSON, Avro, Parquet, ORC)
Experience with messaging (Kafka, Solace, RabbitMQ)
Experience working on Agile projects
Targeted Degrees and Disciplines:
Targeted Clusters
			

		
		
			
				- Theme - Business Administration
				
			
				- Theme - Computing: Information Systems 
				
			
				- Theme - Computing: Software
				
			
				- Theme - Data Analytics, Statistical Analysis and Mathematical Optimization 
				
			
				- Theme - Information Science and Data Management 
				
			
				ENG - Software Engineering
				
			
				MATH - Computer Science

Job Summary:
Interested applicants must apply through WaterlooWorks and directly to the employer to be considered for this position (see "Additional Application Information" section).

What is the opportunity?
Who wouldn't want to be a part of a fantastic team of Data Scientists?  At RBC, our Data Science teams offer the opportunity to leverage RBC's data assets to develop innovative solutions in support of RBCs big data strategy. This position is an essential part to the bank as you develop next-generation applications to meet our customers' needs. By joining the RBC team as a Data Scientist, you will have the opportunity to analyze, design and implement data solutions to assist all business customers. Please only apply if you are available for 8 months.
Job Responsibilities:
What will you do?

Utilize the latest technologies available, designing and building data solutions to meet business needs
Be an active contributor to not only your individual team, but to the RBC development community
Constantly seek out better ways to do things, new tools, new technologies, new processes
Work on transformational projects delivering new value
Work as part of an agile team responsible for end-to-end delivery of business needs
Deploy production-scale solutions using the Hadoop Ecosystem, transforming statistical and machine learning models from single node architecture to parallel processing grid technology
Use business domain knowledge to independently lead the analytics process to identify valuable and innovative insights
Promote analytics across the enterprise to enable RBC to become a data-driven organization
Required Skills:
What do you need to succeed?
Must-have

Programming skills in one or more of the following languages: Python or R
Experience utilizing SQL scripts/querying
Proficient in building statistical and algorithmic models with complex and large datasets, including but not limited to: supervised statistical learning, clustering, natural language processing, recommendation systems, times-series analysis, experimental design (A/B testing), data visualization, deep learning
Ability to data extract, transform, and load processes with a variety of data types
Ability to perform complex data analysis on large volumes of data and present findings to stakeholders

Nice-to-have


Experience with big data technologies, primarily in machine learning and statistics function
Exposure to Apache Spark, Hadoop and Public Cloud technologies, data serialization (JSON, Avro, Parquet, ORC)
Experience with big data processing tools like Spark and Hive, GitHub functionality and workflow experience/exposure
Experience with messaging (Kafka, Solace, RabbitMQ) & working on Agile projects

What is the opportunity?
We're looking for an enthusiastic software engineer who's excited by the opportunity of being at the forefront of machine learning technology, and working on extremely challenging problems. As a Co-op Machine Learning Software Engineer, you'll be involved a project end to end - everything from data pre-processing to implementing machine learning algorithms and front-end development.

At Borealis AI, you'll be joining a team that works directly with leading researchers in machine learning, has access to rich and massive datasets, and offers the computational resources to support ongoing development in areas such as reinforcement learning, unsupervised learning and computer vision. You can find out more about our research areas at borealisai.com.

About Borealis AI
Borealis AI, a RBC Institute for Research, is a curiosity-driven research centre dedicated to achieving state-of-the-art in machine learning. Established in 2016, and with labs in Toronto, Montreal, Waterloo and Vancouver, we support academic collaborations and partner with world-class research centres in artificial intelligence. With a focus on ethical AI that will help communities thrive, our machine learning scientists perform fundamental and applied research in areas such as reinforcement learning, natural language processing, deep learning, and unsupervised learning to solve ground-breaking problems in diverse fields.

				MATH - Computer Science

What is the opportunity?
RBC's National Indigenous Student Internship Program aims to help students, who self-identify as Indigenous/Aboriginal (First Nations, Inuit, Métis), develop the skills and network needed to build their career in banking. Be a part of an exciting four month experience which gives you exposure to a specific functional area of the bank in Finance, Operations, Advice Centre, Audit, Risk Management, Retail/Commercial Banking, Capital Markets and Technology. Our program is designed to hone in on your skills, explore your strengths, and build the career you want. For more information on our Indigenous initiatives, please refer to https://jobs.rbc.com/ca/en/IndigenousPeoples
Job Responsibilities:
What will you do?

By joining us for a 4-month long summer position, you will be involved in a variety of challenging assignments, allowing you to become familiar with an area of RBC, while also strengthening the skills and knowledge you need to launch a successful career. Our students benefit from interesting work and networking opportunities, and are encouraged to collaborate on innovations.
Required Skills:

Currently studying Business, Finance, Accounting, Mathematics/Statistics, Computer Sciences, Policy, Arts or a related discipline
Proficient in PowerPoint, Excel, Word and ability to master new computer software
Excellent interpersonal and highly developed communication skills (verbal and written)
Ability to build strong working relationships with key partners
Strong detail orientation and ability to multi-task
Strong problem solving and analytical skills
Data analytics and data visualization tools

Previous experience working in a financial environment 
Knowledge and experience working with data analytics software packages, data visualization tools and programming languages (Tableau, C++, VBA, Python, R, SAS, SQL, etc.)

Job Summary:

What is the opportunity?
Use your communications experience to enable RBC's 85,000 employees to find everything they need to know about technologies they use every day. You'll be one of two content curators for Tech Hub, an internal portal that helps RBC employees navigate technology. Launched in 2019, Tech Hub has over 4 million views, and recently won an international award for intranet design (Intra.NET Reloaded's "Best User Experience"). Significantly more than website management, our team imagines new solutions to transform how employees engage with self-serve tech support for a more efficient, meaningful day.
 
In addition, this role will work with Corporate Communications to support town halls and develop executive-level and employee communications for the Technology & Operations team (8,000).
 
In this role, you'll gain proficiency in writing, event planning, employee experience, data analysis, an agile framework, project management and cross-team relationships in a large organization.
Job Responsibilities:
What will you do?

Tech Hub:
	
Be part of a passionate team that seeks creative ways to enhance the employee's technology experience at RBC
Advise tech teams on how to curate online content; writing and website creation
Manage relationships with subject matter experts
Stay in-step with what matters to employees through metrics, usability testing and other employee experience sessions
Drive improvements to our search and navigation experiences
Support a re-imagining of how we share technology news and alerts with RBC employees


Technology & Operations (T&O) Communications:
	
Support town halls and events
Assist with executive communications for the T&O team
Develop online stories for T&O audiences
Required Skills:
What do you need to succeed?
Must-have

Great writing and editing skills
An eye for design
Ability to portray complex ideas in simple ways
Ability to prioritize independently
Creativity to dream up better ways to serve our colleagues, and confidence to make it happen
Ability to manage multiple projects at the same time, keeping colleagues on schedule
Comfort working in an agile environment, where priorities can shift
Ready to ask questions when you're unsure about next steps

Nice-to-have


Graphic design
Appreciation of technology and employee experience
Experience working with senior managers / executives
Experience with Jive or other intranet / social media platforms
